I have the IR thingy about 3 inches from my cable box pointing up at the cable box IR hole at a 45 degreee angle.  I just programmed my favorites in the remote and click like crazy until it finally hits the channel I want.  It seems when I want channel 44 or something, it'll only catch one number - the first or last - so this is easier.  :)

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after just over a month
Reviews.Author: elli
Reviews.Content: I received this item June 19, 2011.  The setup was easy and the signal was great on all 4 channels.  Yesterday, August 5, it stopped working altogether.  The signal broke up pretty badly for a couple of minutes and then it quit.  No signal on any channel and no amount of adjustment brought helped in any way.Of course it is about 2 weeks past the return window with amazon.  I have requested a refund anyway and we'll see if amazon supports their customers.  A $102.00 piece of electronic equipment should not be dead after a month of use.Save your money.Edited to add that amazon quickly agreed to make an exception to their return policy under the circumstances.  So although the product I received is clearly defective, kudos to amazon for their professionalism.

Reviews.Title: Mislead while the calendar ticked off 6o days on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Joy L. Mchargue "joymch"
Reviews.Content: The Seller told my husband that we must have bought a defective unit and could we please just send back for testing. This took us out of Amazon's loop which was one mistake. Then, the delays to get it back to us just in time to clock out the 60 days when we could use Amazon's buyer protection.Apparently, my husband has now read more reviews to find many customers share the problem we had so that is why I titled "mislead".We returned the original item within a few weeks so should have had the new one in plenty of time to discover the problem was ongoing. However, multiple excuses and delays conveniently ticked the clock so we are stuck with this item.So, lesson learned, do not go outside of Amazon ever when buying on this site!

Reviews.Title: Great if I only need 2 minutes of TV
Reviews.Author: J. Benardini
Reviews.Content: When hooking this product up to my DISH network 311 receiver it only worked for 2 minutes, wonderfully I might add, then would stop. I did this three times and thought I would write to the company for support, due to the instruction manual lacking information. Well I now see that the instruction manual originated from this same company, because I still have yet to hear a response email back from them and its been over two weeks!! In concept this is a great product, but still needs tons of work and support along with it.

Reviews.Title: Working for almost 2 years now.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Charlie
Reviews.Content: Installed in conference room since tv was on opposite side of the room.  We mounted the units on the walls so that people walking by wouldn't cause interference with signal and made sure that the antennas had a clear path to each other.  None of the other electronics or wireless networks have interfered with the operation.

Reviews.Title: Two versions, only one works
Reviews.Author: P. Massardo
Reviews.Content: I have two of these units, one of which I am returning. The older one has the little upright antenna on the front, as shown in the photo. It works great, sending TV signals wirelessly from a satellite receiver to a TV with no satellite connection. It also has a remote IR mouse for controlling the source device. I love that version.BUT, the new version does not have that little antenna. It is supposed to work the same way, but I have now had THREE of them, and none can transmit the remote signal to change the channel. It sends the video/audio fine, but the IR mouse does not work. The older one is better!Be careful!!! Even if the photo shows the little antenna on the front, you may receive the newer one without that. BTW, the model numbers are the same, so you can't even tell which one is which!!! ALSO, the manufacturer, RF Link USA, is of NO HELP with tech support. Repeated e-mails go unanswered, even unacknowledged. Too bad there are few alternatives for this item.

Reviews.Title: Works great so far
Reviews.Author: jgip
Reviews.Content: Been using this to watch directv downstairs (the box is in a room almost directly upstairs). Have it connected to a projector to watch football on the living room wall. No lag. Audio is fine. Sometimes signal slightly choppy,  but switching the channel on the  two devices usually fixes that. The ability to use the directv remote with the device is awesome.  Uses regular rca cables instead of hdmi,  but my directv box and projector don't have hdmi support anyway,  so not an issue for me.  Does just what I need and making us very happy during  football season.

Reviews.Title: great system, but doesnt change change channels
Reviews.Author: Lime Mile
Reviews.Content: nice picture and sound, however, the system did not change the channels making the entire system useless.  Beware before you buy

Reviews.Title: Audio and Video sender and RECEIVER.
Reviews.Author: William R. Porter
Reviews.Content: I was attempting to buy the sender to replace the same model that no longer worked.  The box contained the sender as well as a receiver.  The new sender sends a better signal and when paired with new receiver I now get an improved video and sound than I had with the original pair.

Reviews.Title: Not great for computer applications
Reviews.Author: Brent Blazek
Reviews.Content: I needed it to transmit an extended computer desktop.  The resolution was not good.  I wasn't happy with the quality.

Reviews.Title: Going into the garbage can after 4 months
Reviews.Author: AceFlyer
Reviews.Content: Although I initially liked this unit, after using it for 4 months it is going into the garbage can. I am replacing it with the wired StarTech.com COMPUTPEXTA Composite Video Extender which sends the video and stereo audio over a simple Cat 5 cable. Amazon sells this.The problem is that this unit couldn't send a clear video signal down a hallway to an under-the-counter kitchen TV about 40 feet away. The video was ALWAYS fuzzy and grainy, but tolerable. The audio would someimes cut out for no reason, and if you sat near the set and moved a few inches left or right, this would noticably impact the signal.If you have an empty room, and want to throw a signal from one side to another of the same room, fine. If you want to go from downstairs to upstairs, or through any walls, think twice and be warned.The wired solution I mentioned is both cheaper, and gives you far better quality. Unfortunately, you'll have to get a separate infrared extender for your remote if using it at the remote TV is important to you.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful as advertised don't hesitate to buy
Reviews.Author: Plymouth
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied.  Package included transmitter, receiver, remote IR, 2 power adapters and 2 RCA to RCA cables.  My situation is a cable set top box located in the main floor living room with a tv that we don't seem to use.  So I moved the tv to a den on the next floor(tv located about 50 plus feet away from the cable box).Transmitting through 3 walls plus the ceiling/floor.  It took me about 1 hour to get it set up and working with a very clear picture and great sound.  Another hour to get the Antennas adjusted so that the remote worked from the den upstairs had to try different channels.  Having the remote work from upstairs was well worth the time.  I should mention that there is a very slight delay when using the remote for the channel to change.  My alternative...was to have my cable company come out and somehow get a cable to the upstairs den from the basement where it enters the house...not very desirable.

Reviews.Title: Reading the manual really is important.
Reviews.Author: Mark S. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I connected the system and got absolutely nothing.  I repositioned both the transmitter and receiver....nothing.  Played with all of the settings.....nothing.  Went back to the 4 page manual, and there it was.  There is a TRANSMITTER that goes on the transmitting tv and a RECEIVER that goes on the receiving tv.  DUH!  When I hooked them up correctly, instant picture, very nearly high definition quality.  There is a selector button on both units that you can change to improve the picture.  If you change it on one end, it automatically changes on the other.  Had a little interference, but eliminated it quickly with this selector.  I was prepared to not be able to use my remote, but I found by reading the manual you can point the transmitter at your transmitting device (tv, dvr, cable box) and have a fully functional remote at the receiving tv.  This is an amazing, inexpensive, easy to use system that enables me to watch television in my backyard with the guys without upsetting my wife.  Minimum wires, ease of setup.  It's all good.  Go for it!!

Reviews.Title: This is a great product
Reviews.Author: BH
Reviews.Content: I have actually purchased two of these units. One for me, and one for my father-in-law. I originally purchased a TERK unit from Best Buy, but the picture was so poor that I couldn't even get audio. The TERK unit runs on 2.4Ghz signal while this unit runs on a 5.8Ghz signal. The picture is clear and sound quality is great with this unit. Even though it is not a HD picture signal, the quality is more than acceptable. Oh....my father in law has a 5.8Ghz phone system in his house, and the unit still functions great for him without any interruption.

Reviews.Title: Performs well
Reviews.Author: TS
Reviews.Content: This is my second set of these.  The transmitter on the first set died after about 4 years, but it does what it is advertised to do

Reviews.Title: WORKS PERFECTLY
Reviews.Author: LES BROWER
Reviews.Content: I connected the transmitter directly to the cable box in our family room and connected the receiver to the kitchen TV, pointed the antennas from both at each other and it worked immediately.  There is a guest bathroom with tiled walls between the family room and kitchen.  The signal penetrated perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly
Reviews.Author: Carol Mae "Carol Mae"
Reviews.Content: I used this when I set up my Slingbox 350 because the TV was on another wall from the slingbox and DirecTV receiver and I did not want wires on the floor.  I can't believe how clear the TV picture is (and its a really old TV).  Works much better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: RF Link AVS-5811
Reviews.Author: GAW
Reviews.Content: Excellent product.  Easy to set up and performs well.  If you want to use the remote control for the cable box to control your remote TV, it's to plug one end of the range extender into the RF link and place the the other end (IR sensor end) next the the IR sensor on the cable box.

Reviews.Title: Quality Drop
Reviews.Author: Desert Guy
Reviews.Content: I have owned this model for several years and have been satisfied so when it finally quit I immediately purchased the same model again. The IR repeater for the remote did not work on the new one even though the transmitter and receiver were placed in the same position as the old one. RF Signal was very good. I sent it back for a replacement which Amazon did very quickly. The second one was worse than the first. IR repeater still did not work and now the RF signal deteriorates and comes back about five minutes into use so the picture fades to snow along with the sound then pops back on. Will look for alternative product.

Reviews.Title: This is a great transmitter.
Reviews.Author: Luis Martino A "cygnus"
Reviews.Content: I bought this product to replace this one: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0087YUHX6/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prod_ttl which was a completely piece of crap.I live inside an appartment, and I wanted a transmitter which could send the signal from a satellite dish receiver located in a room to a TV installed in the kitchen. Between the transmitter and the receiver there is a distance of 15 meters, more or less, and two brick walls between them, but noneless the picture quality is excellent. When I first connected the RF Link, the picture and sound was a bit noisy, but I was able to solve that by trying the different transmission channels from 1 to 4. I found that channel 4 gave me a clean picture.The remote control retransmision is a bit tricky, though. In the kitchen where the TV is located there is a fluorescent lamp fixture with an electronic ballast, and while the lamp is on the remote control retransmision didn't worked at all. Seems to me that the fixture produces a huge amount of infrared light which interferes with the remote control sensor of the RF Link. To solve this minor problem, I simply located the RF Link receiver in a place where the light from the ceiling lamp doesn't reach it.I like the performance of this product, and I can recommend it without any reservation.

Reviews.Title: Photo is deceptive
Reviews.Author: HL "HL"
Reviews.Content: I bought this exact model 2 1/2 years ago and wanted to add a few more. Unlike the old style these have annoying red light in the front that is blinding. these do not come with the external antenna that they show in the picture. This system does not work in combination with the old style. If you don't find this review helpful- I really could care less...but I do wish someone would have wrote this review before I bought it.

Reviews.Title: WOW - great product!
Reviews.Author: Dennis L. Gardner "Dennis"
Reviews.Content: My main TV and cable box is in my rec room in the basement. Wanted to put another tv in the family room upstairs and didn't want to run cable wire. Viola, the RF Link AVS-5811 5.8GHz Audio and Video Transmission System with IR Repeater to the rescue. The signal would have to go thru the floor as my downstairs tv is right below the second tv. So I'm not sure what results someone would have if the distance were greater or have to penetrate more than one floor.Delivery was quick with Prime and packaging was very good. The instructions aren't that clear but these are so basic that that's not an issue. I hooked them up, kinda pointed the antennas at each other and turned on the tv. Got a pretty clear picture right away. I believe I can dial the picture in a bit better but it's really good as is.The system includes a transmitter and receiver, two power sources, two six foot sets of RCA video/audio cables and an IR mouse. Connect the transmitter to your cable box (or whatever you want to control wirelessly) and put the mouse in front of the cable box (this mouse is what actually signals the cable box to change channels). Connect the receiver to the second tv, turn it all on and you'll be watching the second tv instantly.The only thing missing is a remote to send signals to the receiver. I went to Comcast and they gave me another remote control for free!I'm VERY happy with this system and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great product, easy to set up, and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Barbara J. Stevens "alwaysonline"
Reviews.Content: I have digital cable and rent a cable box for each TV in the house.  I wanted a way to connect my office TV to cable without having to have someone install coax for me and rent another cable box.  I found this product and decided to give it a try.  I'm very please with it.  It was easy to set up.  The only place in the setup anyone may have difficulty with is going into the TV settings to set the TV to auxillary.  If you don't know how to do this part, you might struggle with the setup, but otherwise it's very easy to do.  My transmitter and receiver are about 25 feet apart (office down the hall from the bedroom) and the reception is extremely good.  The remote for the cable box from the bedroom works in the office without fail.I plan on getting another receiver to connect a TV in another bedroom down the hall.  The fewer cable boxes I have to rent the better!  This product has been an excellent solution for my husband and I.  We're not inconvenienced by having one cable box control the cable for more than one TV.  We can only watch one TV at a time anyway.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup
Reviews.Author: Richard J Hoag
Reviews.Content: From box to watching TV was less than 20 minutes. Plug the cords in, power it up and orient the antennas. I am amazed at the quality of the video and sound. No interference with other household devices. My distance is from a bedroom to a garage, about 40 feet through 3 walls. IR for the remote functioned flawlessly. Can't say enough about the product. I plan to do a lot of wireless in a house being built and I'll definitely buy more rather than run cables.

Reviews.Title: Super fast delivery and installation in 20 minutes flat!
Reviews.Author: Ben T
Reviews.Content: I chose the new Local Delivery Express option in the wee hours of the morning on Monday and had it in my hands the same Monday evening. It took me all of 20 minutes to install this between my cable box (Time Warner) in the living room (which is already attached to a 60" plasma via HDMI) and my new flat panel 32" flat panel tv in my den/office.  The installation instructions are simple and couldn't be any easier.  The RGA cables are color matched for video out/in on your transmitter and receiver device, respectively.  All I needed to do was switch the office/den television to AV input and shazam!  Great picture and sound, no interference from my nearby cable modem.  I am experiencing no picture or sound delay/degradation at all.  I then hooked the IR remote wire up to the transmitter and placed it with the sticky side in the cable box remote reception area and voila!  The cable box remote works perfectly from my office so I don't have to go into the living room to change the channel.  This set up also allows me to leave the living room television off as it is attached directly to the signal coming from the cable box.  Thrilled with the results AND the $ savings that I get not having to pay for another cable box far exceeds the cost of the entire Amazon order.

Reviews.Title: Great repeater, does just what it says, no signal problems at all.
Reviews.Author: Techman "6-T"
Reviews.Content: Needed a repeater to send video and audio from a sat box to a tv in another room.  This item works just fine and I had no problems with signal loss as some have said.  I suspect it all depends on the individual location - mine just went through one wall (even with foil backed insulation in it) for a 35 foot total distance.  Unit did not get overly hot, just slightly warm on the base.  The directions leave much to be desired, and the imagination, but I was able to set it up and get it working with no problem; just had to make sure that both Xmtr and Rcvr were set to the same "channel"; just press Channel button enough times to light up the channel you need.  Since there are only RCA plugs for the L & R audio plus one for the video the signal is not going to be HD, only SD so you will need to choose the picture aspect ratio that satisfies your preferences.  If positioning is an issue just get a longer RCA cable set and move the unit(s) to a better location (easier than moving the TV).-->>>UPDATE: March 2013 -- I purchased this in May 2012 to use with a DISH receiver and the audio and video work fine through a wall, door and the TV screen all in a row. I used the DISH remote for 9 mos before finding out that the DISH remote used a UHF signal to change the channels and not an IR beam. I found this out after trying a universal remote which did work directly with the DISH receiver in the same room but NOT with the RF-Link from another room with a good AV signal. I confirmed it was the RF-Link IR repeater that was not working by using a 15-year old Radio Shack IR pyramid repeater which DID work from a remote location/other room. . SO MY INITIAL RATING OF 5 IS NOW REDUCED TO 3: the AV part works fine, but the IR linkage does not.

Reviews.Title: Extra FIOS box
Reviews.Author: Dnewto
Reviews.Content: Using to send FIOS box signal to workout room.  Signal is not having to travel far, but it works great and the remote repeater is great.  Considering getting another box for the other room with no cable right now.  Very happy overall.

Reviews.Title: RF-Link A/V Transmitter - Receiver System
Reviews.Author: Steve M
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product to transmit cable audio & video via wireless to a tv on my deck / patio.  The RF-Link product was very easy to set up; installed in about 5 minutes. The signal I am sending needs to pass through 1 wall & a glass patio door.The reception is crisp & clear & the audio is of good quality as well. Some slight image flicker is observed when people stand between the transmitter & receiver for extended perios of time, but overall, I am very satisfied with the results & the price.

Reviews.Title: My Second
Reviews.Author: Den M
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement for my first RF Link. The first lasted 6+yrs operating flawlessly 24/7. We have cable TV and to get a second cable box would cost me $15/mo. that's $180/yr x 6= $1080!! saved.When my new RF Link arrived it wouldn't send the remote control orders to the RX'r. Got an RA and returned, the replacement arrived about a week later and has been performing well. Currently I'm using it to connect our house and my office which is about 50ft behind the house.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: travel22jb
Reviews.Content: I ordered this to get rid of a addional satillite box for a tv that is not used much.  It works great, transmitting the signal about 50 feet thur three walls, and a kitchen.  The signal is nice and strong, but some of the HD statations are a little mimshaped as the receiving TV is not HD TV.But it better than paying a monthly fee..............I would recommend this product.  Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Works as well as expected
Reviews.Author: digduga
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous on buying this product, as some of the reviews are not favorable and I was installing this in a basement TV. It works fine, through insulated walls and the floor with no distortion or sound issues (this save me adding an expensive DirecTV receiver). Do wish it would carry a better picture option other than AV hookups, but I'm guessing the technology isn't there yet and it would be crazy expensive. All in all a really great product.

Reviews.Title: Good video transmission poor remote control extender
Reviews.Author: Steve Stats
Reviews.Content: Received the product on time as is typical from Amazon. We Bought this product to provide satellite transmission from our basement home theater to our daughthers bedroom on the 2nd floor.  The product differs somewhat from the illustration as it does not have the front orientable infra-red extender antenna.  While video transmission works well the remote control extender is only operational from a couple of feet at best.  We had to buy a seperate remote control extender to make it work.

Reviews.Title: Subject to interference
Reviews.Author: gimmr
Reviews.Content: This product worked as advertised except for a very loud burst of noise and blacking out of TV picture at random intervals, several times in an evening. I tried all four channels with the same result. This problem could have been with the product and not interference. The company did not respond to a description of this problem via their email.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product - works great!
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I finally found something that does what it says it does. It took me 5 minutes to hook it up, and when I turned it on I imediately had an excellent audio and video signal. I had read customer reviews about all of the potential problems like wifi, microwave, and cordless phone interference and I've had no problems what so ever. work great... I highly recommend if you don't want to fool with running cable and paying for another tuner and all.

Reviews.Title: It just works
Reviews.Author: Don Diego
Reviews.Content: I previously had a TERK Leapfrog.  It was old, the antenna was falling off, it was subject to interference and caused interference with my Wi-Fi.  It was time to move up.I received the RF-Link on the 11th of October.  That night, I pulled the TERK out and put the RF-Link in.  Installation was trivial; I had everything worked correctly within a few minutes.  Better yet, the video stayed clear when I used the microwave or the Wi-Fi.  And Wi-Fi performance improved dramatically both in throughput and range.I had some issues initially where it would stop working (and then start).  I suspect interference from other folks living near me.  Whatever they were doing before seems to have stopped as I've had no issues after the first month.  Good product overall.  I'm still curious why I had issues early on, but it's been working well for over a year with no issues.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is fair, but it's great being able to watch TV where there's no cable jack
Reviews.Author: T. Chang
Reviews.Content: We wanted to place a TV in a room without a cable jack. So we had a couple of options: Run a coaxial cable to that room and then pay a monthly fee for an extra digital cable converter (we have Comcast and all TVs have to be connected through a box, which stinks). Or buy a wireless transmitter like this one with no additional monthly fee. We decided to give option #2 a try. We have our main TV in the basement and the new TV is on the 2nd floor, perhaps 20 feet away from a point directly above the transmitter. It was tricky getting the antennae pointed just right. I had to have my daughter on a cell phone on one end while I was on the other, and we kept adjusting a tiny bit at a time until the picture was as good as it was going to get. The best we could get was a mildly noisy picture. There are 4 different channels you can use. The sound is very good, however. There's a red infrared remote control relay that has to be placed facing the front of the main cable box to get the upstairs remote control to work. The remote works well through this device. We're happy to be able to watch cable TV in a room without a cable jack and without having to pay a monthly fee, but the picture quality is only fair. Also, please note that with this unit, the channel you watch on the 2nd TV has to be the one that's on the main TV, but this was not an issue for us since we don't watch both TVs at the same time.

Reviews.Title: It really works!
Reviews.Author: SC
Reviews.Content: Wow! I was prepared to start drilling holes to run cable when I came across this product. Past experiences with wireless video have not been positive so I had low expectations. The box arrived yesterday and 15 minutes later I was watching TV in a room 40ft down the hall from the cable box. I didn't even have to spend time with alignment of the antennas.Pros:Works straight out of the box with easy set-up.Good video and sound quality on through a Samsung 22" LCD TVCons:Bright red LED that I'll cover with a piece of electrical tape.The antenna won't rotate 180 degrees so the unit has to be at a bit of an angle as the viewing area in my set-up is 180 degrees from direction of the transmitter.Overall 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: Works... but not as well as expected
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Weber "Red Lotus Katie"
Reviews.Content: One of the things I love to do when making dinner is watch the evening news, but my kitchen was not equipped for a cable outlet (sort of surprising since it's a 1 year old home). Rather than spend thousands on having the kitchen wired, I decided to give the LINK AVS a try. It was small and easy to hook up and the price was right. Plus, set up was faster than scheduling a cable person to come run a new cable, not to mention the wear and tear. My kitchen is about 40 feet from my TV room. So here are my pros and cons:PROS:  Inexpensive and easy alternative to expensive wiring, small size, easy hook up, good reception*CONS:  There's really only one: reception. The units have to be facing one another and are very persnickety about interference from furniture, people walking by, etc. The units remind me of the old television antennas that had to be positioned in a mysteriously odd way and are as fussy as old TV antennas. But, once the they're set, they work well.My experience is so-so with this product and I gave it a so-so rating of three stars. Still, it's an inexpensive fix.

Reviews.Title: RF Link 5.8GHz transmitter and receiver after two years
Reviews.Author: eabwings
Reviews.Content: This product is very easy to use and works great as long as the transmtter and receiver antennas are pointed at each other (even through walls). I can transmit a clear signal over 75 feet. The picture will degrade if it is obstructed by peoples bodies (i.e. you walk in front of the receiver or transmitter). Also, you have to point your remote control directly at the front of the receiver to effectively change channels with the IR remote function, but it does work. You also have to make sure that the IR extender that comes off the transmitter is directly in front of the IR sensor in your cable\satellite\or UVerse box.I did have an issue that a lot of the other reviewers had after having the unit for about a year. I was watching sports on my back deck using the receiver (about 50 feet from the transmitter in my upstairs master bedroom) and the receiver suddenly went out - just died. I thought the unit went bad similar to what happened with all the other reviewers. I happen to have a universal adapter that a got from Radio Shack with multiple voltage settings and adapter plugs. I decided to try using that adapter to power the receiver and it worked! So if you have a transmitter or receiver that has just "died", try using a different power source like my universal AC adaptor before you throw it away.Overall I am very happy with the usefullness of the product, just a little disappointed with the quality of the receiver's power plug.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: FireTechyPJ
Reviews.Content: After searching around on the internet I came across this item.  I was a little skeptical about it working to send a signal from an upstairs cable box to a TV that I wanted to mount one floor below it in a garage.  After hooking it up and roughly pointing the antennas towards each other I must admit the picture is perfect.  I can now watch and control the extra TV just as well as if I ran coax cable right to it.  So far I have been really happy with the product.  It looks and feels rather cheaply made so I will keep my fingers crossed as to the durability of the units.  Well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Would recommend this to anyone...
Reviews.Author: Amy Detjen
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about this product, but I ordered it because I knew Amazon would refund me if I didn't like it. I had to stand on my head a little bit to get it plugged in (my fault, not the product's), then I took my DirecTV remote with me upstairs and hooked up the other half. I clicked on the button to change the source (input) for my TV and voila - I was watching the programs from my DVR on a different TV in my house.I have seen no interference from the microwave, or my Panasonic 5.8 hz cordless phone. The infrared mouse thingamajig that sends the commands from the remote to the box works perfectly, and I didn't need a signal booster. (However, if a cat knocks the little red thing onto the floor, the remote stops working - luckily I figured out the problem on my own.) I used the sticky stuff that came with the units to attach the infrared thing and now that won't happen again.I am so glad to have this. I didn't want to run new cords to the room upstairs, because the installers around here just drill a huge hole in the side of the house and send the wires in. It's really unsightly on the outside. This was a perfect solution for me.Both the sender and receiver use the red/white/yellow connectors, which may not be hi-tech enough for some people, but it works perfectly for me.

Reviews.Title: RF-Link AVS-5811 5.8GHz Audio and Video Transmission System with IR Repeater
Reviews.Author: Virginia Wistrand "Virginia"
Reviews.Content: I had a Terk transmitter/receiver to use for an extra television in my home.  I accidentally broke it so ordered this different brand. This one is actually a much better system.  I don't get the interference from my cordless phones and microwave that I got with the Terk.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Freaking Amazing!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Maurice Wright
Reviews.Content: I needed this product for the last three months.  I must admit I was scared to purchase it.  I really didnt think it would work, and after doing some intensive research and reading all the reviews, I decided to try it out so I could know for myself.  Well I have to say for far this year, this has been one of my best decisions.  This product is absouluty remarkable.  I really dont understand why it received any negative reviews.  I have told any and everybody about this, and maybe be looking to do the same.  To give you a brief summary of the hookup.  You know most basements have a room similiar to a bedroom, but dont have a cable connection.  So I wanted to use the existing connection in the Recreation Room to received TV reception in the Bedroom.  I was very skeptical because there was no direct line of sight, and the signal would have to press thru a few walls.  But after reading the directions (and some reviews), once i hook up everything I got the so-call lines and static that some mention in the reviews.  But like it tells you to do in the instructions.  Ensure the antennas are facing each other the best way possible.  So after one very small adjustment, I received HD quality reception on a 37" LED TV.  So needless to say, I am a very happy camper right now.  And the remote sensor works perfectly.  Just ensure you cable box is on.!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Very good so far
Reviews.Author: Kayur J. Patel "KP"
Reviews.Content: It's easy to setup, no back and forth adjustment required.  I have directv on ground floor attached to transmeter and receiver on first floor in the bedroom, signal has to go thru at least two walls.  I had 2.4 gb trek before which required lots of adjustment and it stopped working after year.  I am impressed.

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Deborah
Reviews.Content: Installs easily. I get a slight blip ever once in while but overall, I love it. I bought one for my sis and she liked it so much, I bought myself one. I might not hook up the main tv because you don't receive HD on it but that was the only drawback I had.

Reviews.Title: Little to no setup
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Eric G"
Reviews.Content: I previously used the Leapfrog and had issues with reception. I would spend 20-30 minutes trying to get the picture right.  With the 5.8ghz, I plugged in the transmitter in the basement, turned it on and plugged in the IR and set it next the the Direct TV box.  I headed up to the 2nd floor, plugged it in to the tv and turned it on and everything was fine.  There was no static in the sound or picture.  The only time that static comes into play is when the remote it used to change the channel, but once you are done using the remote, everything is back to normal.  I loved the old leapfrog, but it really could only work on shorter distances, but the AVS-5811 works between 2 floors and about the furthest distance I could be in the house.

Reviews.Title: Great solution
Reviews.Author: David Naylor "Woodworking Guy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the AVS 5811 about two months ago to replace a Terk 2.4 GHZ transmitter.  I was never happy with the Terk 2.4, it seemed like everything interfered with the signal (the microwave, the cordless phone, my son's xbox, etc.).  In addition the Terk seemed a bit flimsy, so when the antenna broke on the transmitter, I decided to but the  RF-Link unit.Out of the box it is very easy to set up (it took less than three minutes to have it up and working).  I did not use the remote control extender as the signal only needs to travel about 25 feet.  Overall, the picture quality is very good (not full HD so you might notice degradation on a 60 inch screen but on a smaller screen it is fine).  The sound quality is also very good as well although there is a slight static sound (perfectly acceptable just not  dead silent).  The best part of the RF-Link 5.8 GHz is that there is no interference that I have discovered.

Reviews.Title: Buy One Now
Reviews.Author: L.I. Mom
Reviews.Content: I have to tell you I was some what skeptical about how good the picture quality would be when I opened the box and began the installation process. I hooked it up to the HD Scientific Atlantic cable box in the living room and plugged the power in and aimed the antenna in the general direction of the kitchen. I then connected it to the 20 inch LG television and aimed that antenna in the general direction and plugged it in. WOW, picture and sound quality are spectacular. Set up time took 5 minutes, no alignment or tweaking was required. The signal travels through 3 walls and the receiver is right next to a cordless phone. Our cable company stopped the analog signal and a digital cable box is required for each television in the house (at additional cost for each box, of course), I was unwilling to pay a monthly fee to the cable company for service to a television that is only watched 20 or 30 minutes a day for weather and news while the family gets ready in the morning. This is the perfect solution for my problem.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly Effective
Reviews.Author: pixfan
Reviews.Content: I just rented a condo and Comcast came to set up cable TV.  I was amazed to learn that there was no active lead in the living room for TV and internet.  In fact, not only was the master bedroom the only room with an available lead/outlet, but there was no way a run could be made to the living room given the construction style of this multi unit building.After spending a lot of time having other wiring specialists evaluate the situation and reach the same conclusion, I searched the internet for "wireless" solutions.  Several were revealed ranging from several hundred dollars each to $35.  I decided to go with the RF-Link AVS-5811 5.8GHz Audio and Video Transmission System with IR Repeater even though older reviews pointed out issues (I hoped that over time the company may have solved them).It only took 10 minutes to set it up, connect everything and get it going.  The living room TV (42 inch LG HD LCD) came to life with a great picture and excellent sound.  There was no interference issues from my 802.11N Apple Extreme router and wireless internet system nor from my wireless phone system.  I am transmitting over 50 feet through several walls including bathroom walls and mirrors/tile.  I can easily use my remote in the living room to change channels on the cable box in the bedroom and set volume.  All functions work very well.  The system has been working now for several weeks with no heat issues or failures at all as shown in some other older reviews.  I am very impressed with the ease of use and overall quality.  This little system saved my day!Of course, there could always be more features (something other than RCA analog output) and it could look a little better in terms of industrial design, but it works well.

Reviews.Title: IT WORKS WELL BUT YOU HAVE TO BE SURE TO......
Reviews.Author: MATTINHOUSTONTX
Reviews.Content: I struggled for a bit until, by trial and error, I discovered 2 key factors that got it working as it should to connect a second tv to a DIRECTV HD receiver.First, you must connect the transformers for both transmitter and receiver directly into a wall outlet.  For me, it did not work as it should when they were plugged into an extension cord or surge protector serving other devices.Second, as mentioned by many others, any nearby device transmitting on 5.8 will cause some level of interference.  In my case, it was a cordless multi-phone system.  The problem is removed as soon as the base station transmitter is unplugged.  No problem whatsoever with DECT 6.0 phones.Once these two matters were addressed, it seems that the quality of the transmitted picture is relatively insensitive to antenna orientation and such.  I believe the RF-Link will work for everybody but add these 2 suggestions to your bag of tricks.

Reviews.Title: 5.8 ghz model is an excellent product
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Note that there are two versions of this product.  The 5.8 ghz model works perfectly (video, audio, and IR remote control repeater), right out of the box.  I tried the 2.4ghz version first...about $15 cheaper...but it worked very poorly...interference on the video, static on the audio, and unreliable function of the IR remote.

Reviews.Title: remote audio/video sharing
Reviews.Author: E. Jackson
Reviews.Content: PROS: Great system. The 5.8GHZ feature prevents audio/video interference from other appliances such as routers.CONS: The reason for giving only 3 stars for versatility and features is that the receiver only has component connectivity. It would be superior it it had coaxial and component connectors.Overall, I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Would not work but then I.........
Reviews.Author: Alex S. "Alexander S."
Reviews.Content: My friend originally purchased this for his home on my recommendation after reading reviews on Amazon. He wanted to send a DirecTv satellite picture down to his basement.  The signal needed to travel through two walls and a floor.  We would be on the cell phone for about three to five minutes moving the antennas until we got a decent picture.  Well, he finally got tired of the poor picture quality and ordered another receiver from DirecTv for the additional $5 dollars a month.I decided to take the unit to my home and give it a try.  The unit needed to travel only 25 feet through one wall on the same floor.  The picture was even worse at my house and I was tying everything to get it to work.  When I finally got a picture, the signal sender for changing the channels from the remote would stop working.  I had basically given up but here comes the good news. I recently upgraded my cordless phones from 5.8 GHz to Dect 6.0 (1.8 GHz) As most of you know, this signal sender uses the same 5.8 GHz bandwidth. After removing the 5.8 GHz cordless phones the RF Link began working.  You could not even tell it was over the air picture.  I matched it with the Next Generation Remote Control and couldn't be happier.  Get rid or try unpluggig your 5.8 GHz cordless phones and you may be happy with the performance.  I gave it four stars because of its size and bulky looks and poor documentation. Alex S.

Reviews.Title: Love this item!
Reviews.Author: Tamaro
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this item - it works just as I hoped it would. I am able to now watch TV in my office, a room with a TV, but no cable box. The signal is sent from the DVR in my family room to the TV in my office and is clear without any interference. A beautiful picture! Just what I was looking for!  Now - to figure out how to record the signal to my DVD recorder in my office.......

Reviews.Title: RF-Link
Reviews.Author: Gene H "Gene H"
Reviews.Content: I got the RF-Link to send Cable Video to my backyard garage.  My TV in the garage ( about 75 feet away from the house) did not work after the signal went digital.  So I got the RF-Link 5.8GHz to send my cable to the TV.  It was easy to hook up.  The cable box had a 3-component output for the transmitter and the TV had a 3-component input for the receiver.  I hooked them up and without much fooling around the TV had all my cable channels (including the HDTV ones) right away.  Also, I can run the DVR function and any other cable features.  I have only one issue.  The audio has an annoying static pop that I hope will go away when I do a better job of aligning the antennas.  I have not had good luck with wireless (phones and FM headphones) in the past but am very pleased with the RF-link.  I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for bedside video operation
Reviews.Author: chemess
Reviews.Content: I've had this product for more than a year and it is now indispensable to me. I bought it for setting up a bedroom video system with a ceiling hung TV and DVD player etc at waist height. Running the wires all over without creating a trip hazard was a real challenge until I found this product. But now I have even more need for it... I had an operation and will be bedridden for at least 2 months. So before the surgery I set up a bookcase next to the bed and arranged my DVR, D-Link Medialounge player, and an interface to my laptop for Netflix movies. Then I linked them all to the RF-Link sending unit via the DVR. It works flawlessly. The antennae don't even have to face each other; the sender has even fallen off the bookcase and still sent video to the TV while hanging upside down near the floor. A couple times over the year I had to ask my tall neighbor to unplug the receiving unit then replug it - needed resetting for some reason - but that happened only twice in about 18 months of almost daily use. And it never interferes with wireless signals - the Medialounge, laptop wireless, cell phones, cordless phones, and wifi enabled PDAs are often used within a foot or so of the sending unit, which is always on. This is a good use of your money if you want to eliminate all those wires. If I had a suggestion that would be to add s-video and maybe HDMI video capability.

Reviews.Title: works perfectly
Reviews.Author: mayate46
Reviews.Content: Easy to install in less than ten minutes. I have wireless internet, cordless phone, microwave oven and no interferance at all .

Reviews.Title: Audio Video Transmitter
Reviews.Author: D. Wallace
Reviews.Content: Setting up and connecting the transmitter and receiver to the cable and TV was very easy.  Aligning the units for optimal reception and getting the remote extender to work properly took some time, but now the system works great.  Nice picture and so far I've only noticed interference when someone walks directly between the two units.  I'm very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Works Great - Even with many other devices running
Reviews.Author: Jason Gilbert
Reviews.Content: We use this for a 300' reach and through 1 brick wall in a church that is wired like mad.  We broadcast it over an area featuring a full praise band/multimedia presentation/stage audio/lights/furnaces and fans/and a radio transmitter all running at the same time.  Nothing causes interference.

Reviews.Title: Better than mirror imaging
Reviews.Author: Anita Thompson
Reviews.Content: I bought this because the satellite installer did not do the mirror imaging that I had requested, I am so glad that he didn't.  This product sends a beautiful picture to my second TV and was easy to setup.  Also it sends the signal from the remote so I can change the channel at TV 2 while I am watching it.  I think it's  great product.

Reviews.Title: OK quality but not as good as direct wired TV
Reviews.Author: David W. Crispin
Reviews.Content: Transmitter and receiver Works fine.  I can control my cable DVR box from another room through the infrared link at the recieve end.  Great feature because it gives me full control of my DVR, VCR, DVD, and Stereo from the bathroom, 3 rooms away!The little mini dish antennas dont have to be perfectly aimed to work.I get no interference from other devices such as telephones, WI FI, etc.The picture quality on my remote TV is not as good as a direct wire to the cable box would be and my TV is HD LCD.  Picture is quite acceptable though so I am happy.  Just don't expect a full knock you dead HD pic!So for a remote room TV this is a great device but I wouldnt use it for the primary 56" HD home theatre experience!I have had it on continously for several weeks with no problems.The best part is it saved having to do a major re-wire in my house to get cable into the bathroom.  A re-wire would have cost more to do also so i am a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: Excellent solution to signal interference
Reviews.Author: joandes
Reviews.Content: Previously had audio interference from home wifi router with a transmission system operating at the same 2.4Ghz. This unit solved the problem. High quality signal transmission to tv in home gym in lower level, 70 feet away and through several walls. Highly satisfied with the technology.

Reviews.Title: No more wires under the house
Reviews.Author: TopCat "TC"
Reviews.Content: These set up in minutes and work great for standard video.  There is a little ripple, but it is not worth creeping through the crawlspace to install wires for slightly better quality.

Reviews.Title: Works fine, but I expected a little more
Reviews.Author: J. P. Doire
Reviews.Content: I just bought this to link my computer to the TV in the purpose of seing online movies. Since the computer is in another room, I wanted to go wireless. The image quality is pretty good and stable (not HDTV though). The only trouble was that my video card only has S-video port out, and this unit only has composite video in (RCA). That meant I had to buy an adapter ($80). Too bad this unit wasn't built with an input S-video as well. Pro: setup very easy, no interference with my 2.4 GHz phone.

Reviews.Title: It works and makes my life easier.
Reviews.Author: Buzz006 "buzz006"
Reviews.Content: I could buy a 100 foot coaxial cable and when I want to back up a VHS tape, then I could copy it from one room to the other.  Or in the future if I should have cable move out to the country or satalite TV becomes a better option for me, and I just want to replicate the station from one TV to another, then this is the product for me.  It is simple to setup, I did not even have to read the instructions.  Although, I found out that it had a feature I did need to read the instructions on, but that was it.Why would you want to buy this?  First, it is easy to setup and second, it works.  Simple enough for me.

Reviews.Title: Exponentially Better Than 2.4 GHz
Reviews.Author: J. Schroth
Reviews.Content: First, I tried a 2.4 GHz model because it was cheaper, but the interference/color quality was horrible.  I decided to try this 5.8 GHz unit and the first time I took it out of the box and set it up everything worked perfectly.  Adjusting the antenna helped make it better, but it really didn't need it.  The quality was exponentially better than the 2.4 GHz model and the built-in IR extender saved me from having to buy yet another device for my TV.My wife also appreciated this unit because I was able to place the sender unit behind the TV downstairs and the receiver unit behind the TV upstairs, making it completely invisible (she didn't like the 2.4 GHz model because I had to place it on top of the TV downstairs in order to receive the signal upstairs).Overall, I am very happy with this solution.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: C. Gaffga
Reviews.Content: I use this at a 20 ft distance through a wall.  The picture is great, but sometimes gets a little wavy depending on what's on the screen.  Image is very dark with a lot of color saturation, so I turn up brightness and turn down saturation.  Transmitter and receiver both get very warm and it'd be nice if they would shut down when no signal is being transmitted, rather than having to use the switch on the side.  All that aside, this a great wireless transmitter @ 5.8 gHz (I think it's the only one) and if you're looking to transmit a TV signal (I use it for my TiVo) this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Icebluet
Reviews.Content: I purchased this device about 2 months ago and I instantly became a believer.  This product is excellent.  I initially set up the sender and receiver in my basement, where it displayed outstanding picture and sound quality.  I then took the receiver upstairs to my kitchen where the results were the same.  I then took the receiver upstairs.  To my delight, the sound and picture quality were almost perfect.  This device has saved me from having to put holes in my walls or run wires.  The only time I have problems with the picture is when the phone rings (2.9 GHz wireless phones), and that is only when the active phone is close to the receiver.  Other than that, nothing else affects it.  Not even my linksys wireless network, also 2.9 GHz.  It works great.  Now, if I could just buy the receiver by itself . . .

Reviews.Title: works as expected
Reviews.Author: xleo
Reviews.Content: easy to setup, worked fine and right away. Signal is sended to a distance of more than 30 feet plus 2 walls in between and both video and audio reception are good and stable... Couldn't make remote control receiver to work (so for that is 4 stars instead of five)... is just what i was looking for and works as expected.

Reviews.Title: Impressed
Reviews.Author: W. Leigh
Reviews.Content: I used this to broadcast media from our media center to a portable tv that we move around the house and yard.  I thought there would be some static, but the picture and sound have been good even when the antenna isn't aimed at the base unit.  Additionally, the media center remote works very well when aimed at the receiver.I use this with a small lcd tv so I don't know how well the picture would be on a larger unit.

Reviews.Title: Picture and Audio are great - IR Remote doesn't work
Reviews.Author: C. Lundstrom "CJ"
Reviews.Content: The bottom line is that this product works great and is easy to hook up for what it was really meant to do...  It will transit audio and video wirelessly, through walls, from one TV to another.The only thing that does not work great, is the IR Remote.  In theory, you can have the main TV in your living room, put a 2nd TV in the kitchen and use this device to broadcast audio and video from the living room TV to the Kitchen TV.  Well, that theory is true.  But, in theory you are also supposed to be able to sit in the kitchen, point your remote control at the kitchen TV to change channels and it will change the channel on the living room TV.  This function does not work, period.  No matter how much you play with the position of the transmitte/receiver antennas or the IR remote itself, this feature just doesn't work.I do not get interference with the picture or audio walking around the house.  The quality is very good!  And, I have a wireless internet network in my house and the signal from that does NOT interfere with the signal of the RF Link.

Reviews.Title: works as advertized
Reviews.Author: Daniel Partin
Reviews.Content: I just got this last week, seems to work as it is advertized (I'm always a bit suprized by this). The image looks much the same as when I have the computer hooked up directly (now it is on the second floor).I have not seen any interference, and the remote works fine, with no delay.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy with the Unit
Reviews.Author: AV god (small g)
Reviews.Content: I spent a few weeks looking over wireless transmitters and found units ranging from $30 to over $200. As I was researching I noticed very few bad reviews of products made by RF Link. I was also very happy to see that they made both 2.4 Ghz and 5.8 Ghz units. Most units on the market are 2.4Ghz and I was concerned about reception on this bandwidth. Like most people my home is filled with electronics and a lot of them use 2.4Ghz. That's why most higher quality cordless phones are moving to 5.8. Anyway I choose the 5.8Ghz unit. When I open the box I was happy to see the quality of construction was top notch. No flimsy materials, the instructions were excellant. I had the units running in 2 minutes. I'm transmitting from a Replay TV unit in one end my house to a 61 Inch Sony TV in the other. The quality of the video and sound was 99% of what I get from my direct cable connection. I've had 5 people look at the picture and not one could pick the wireless picture from the standard cable connection. Thank you Amazon and RF link. It's a great product and in fact as soon as I'm done writing this I'm buying another receiver.

Reviews.Title: WOW....what a great device!
Reviews.Author: Stacey C. Apodaca "Surfjumper"
Reviews.Content: When I was doing research on the AV Sender/Receiver I looked at many different brands.  I chose this one specifically because it was a 5.8Ghz and wouldn't interfere with my wireless network or my home phone both of which are on 2.4Ghz channels.  I had to mount in an odd area of my daughter's bedroom.  She has a very large special order loft bed that is shaped like a house and made out of very thick MDF.  She has a TV in her room but was watching it thru a window in front of the house on the top bunk which was very awkward for her.  I had an extra 7 inch lcd monitor used for a portable dvd player so I hooked up the reciever to her tv/dvd player and then mounted the monitor on the underside of the roof area in the top bunk so that it can be pushed flat and adjusted for her viewing.  I then hooked up the reciever to the monitor and tried it out.  I asked her what movie she wanted to watch and put it in the dvd player and when the movie started playing on her new little tv she was so excited.  The picture was perfectly clear with DVD or TV signal.  The sound was excellent.  My daughter was HAPPY that she could watch a movie in comfort.  I'm thinking of getting another one of these devices for my spare bedroom for guests to be able to enjoy cable in that room.  I could not be happier with this device.

Reviews.Title: Works Great !!
Reviews.Author: N. Minawala
Reviews.Content: I am using it to send satellite signal from first floor to second floor bedroom. Picture quality is exceptionaly good. very little distrubance. UHF remote is working through sender/receiver antena. I am really satisfied with the product.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Unit works great
Reviews.Author: enviro
Reviews.Content: I had some concerns about the unit because the 2.8 Ghz that I have tried have suffered from all kinds of static from wireless phones and wireless video cameras. This 5.8 Ghz unit is outstanding, setup is simple and no interference, its close to having a hard wired system.  Saved me a lot of work.Update: Have had the units just under a year they work great but there are some issues.  The first is the frequency. It seems that some of the units out in the market have a narrower frequency than others. Using it with a new Direct TV receiver was a problem. The company has corrected this but if you get one of the older units you won't know why it doesn't work. The company did exchange the units. It was finding out what the problem was that was frustrating.  Secondly my original units were 12v and overheating proved to be a major problem.  At first I just thought I was have interference problems, however, as the units ran over a short period of time they would overheat and loose the signal making it hard to change channels and breaking up the picture.  The company now makes a 9v unit and did exchange the old 12v units. The new ones seem to be fine.I would purchase these again however, if you have any problems don't hesitate call the company they were very helpful. Check which version you are buying the best is the new 9 volt broader frequency units.

Reviews.Title: Works OK But Don't Expect Much Range
Reviews.Author: Rick_E
Reviews.Content: Based on the other reviews I purchased this unit to remotely control my DirecTV Tivo from the basement. With the sender and receiver separated by only eight feet and one floor, the unit works perfectly.The units would not operate, however, when separated by about 30 feet and going through three walls, even after much trial and error aligning of the antenna. Sometimes I could see parts of the picture and hear bits of sound, but the 30 feet was just too far for satisfactory results. I even tried different locations in case nearby electrical wiring might be causing the problem, but always the 30 feet and a couple of walls was just too far.So I can recommend this device only if your sending unit and receiving unit will be no more than 15-20 feet apart.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: hal
Reviews.Content: Cheap unit.  Stay away.  Didn't even last six months.  Only worked if both units were within line of sight of one another.

Reviews.Title: don.t buy it
Reviews.Author: M. H. Alnajjar "mohomar"
Reviews.Content: i brought such product from amazon by 140$, worked only for 3 days then stop sending and receiveng signals, and remote control not working from the begining, i tried to contact the rf link support, they are not responding to emails, not answering phone calls, it looks that i throw 140 bucks in the air, my advice don,t buy it, bad expensive product, no support, no costumer service, just u r throwing ur money, it will work for few days for these money

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: L. Smalla
Reviews.Content: I've owned one of these before when I had Dish Network and it worked exceptionally well.  We sent signalto an upstairs bedroom from the living room and could even change the channel.  We never had any issue withinterference.BUT BEWARE - these come with standard RCA plugs that have to be plugged into the back of the satellite receiver. The instructions say plug into the "TV" but that would not work. Direct TV DVR HD recievers do not have extra RCA spaces to be able to do this.  I can't speakfor any other recievers so check the back of your indiviual unit before buying the RF link.  The instructions say you can buy an adaptor from RCA cable to S-Video + audio but I could not find one that worked.  The audio plug would not fit into anything on the DirectTV receiver.  I also thought about trying an RCA to HDMI adaptor but they are over $100.I eventually gave up and returned the RF link.  Which was very disappointing as the previous oneI had worked (and is still working 5 years later) wonderfully and it was so much easier that having to run cable and use a splitter.

Reviews.Title: Accomplished my goal - no Wireless LAN or Phone interference
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "The Mojo"
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is very good. I get no interference problems from my microwave, phone or wireless LAN anymore. The IR repeater works well for me.

Reviews.Title: Freakin' Awesome
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Lee James "jeremyleejames[DOT]com"
Reviews.Content: This puppy does exactly what it says it can do, and it does it well: namely, untethering your TV from the iron grip of your cable coax outlet, and letting you watch The Sopranos from any where in the house you have access to an electrical outlet.I did get a little interference from my 5.8 GHz wireless phone, but if you don't have one of those, expect crystal-clear reception. You shouldn't talk on the phone and watch TV anyway. It's rude. (Cellphones do NOT interfere, nor do microwaves, wireless routers, or any other electronic equipment).And even if your digital cable box is tucked away in another room in your house, you can still change channels using your remote by pointing at the TV's receiver! I didn't expect this to work very well, but it works flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: The one that WORKS!
Reviews.Author: Ted Moore
Reviews.Content: I've tried other brands and models in the past, and found THIS one to be the only one that works as advertised. Some of the others wouldn't even generate a signal, but this one works flawlessly--even through walls and floors.

Reviews.Title: I've tried the rest, and the AVS-5811 RF Link is the best!
Reviews.Author: Mom "Mom"
Reviews.Content: Works great.  Don't be fooled into buying a cheaper unit - you will regret it.If it's not 5.8GHz, you will have interference problems.  Believe me.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: AK
Reviews.Content: My Cable broke and had not option to install another one without it being visible. This device solved the problem and the reception is mostly very good.

Reviews.Title: RF-Link AVS-5811
Reviews.Author: Walter Wood
Reviews.Content: item does not perform as advertised. Would not send clear signal about 30 foot. Signal was from downstairs to a room almost above it. It transferred the picture signal but could not always change the tv channel.

Reviews.Author: Michael Easa
Reviews.Content: Does not sent "HI-FI" Audio as claimed. The Bass is distorted and there is a static noise at all times. May be ok for just watching T.V but Not for High Quality audio.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: Brian H. Pemberton
Reviews.Content: Absolutely does what it says it will do...Very simple to install.  I have not seen any interference at all.  The remote control works very well, I cannot notice any lag or delay.  Highly recommend this!

Reviews.Title: Product description is WRONG
Reviews.Author: alfonso Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: Folks be aware that what you are buying is only the sender not both the  sender and receiver.  the box it comes in states sender unit , inside there were two slots one for a sender and I suppose one for a receiver, the paperwork inside the box mentions both should be there.  I got two power supplies?  I was given the number for the manufacture/distributor,  but their mail box is full and not taking anymore messages (SURPRIZE! ) - amazon Needs to change the description on this , they did two days after I bought it stating that they were looking into it , but I see they are readvertizing it and nothing is changed??????????very disappointeddoes the product work?  I will never find out

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: MICHAEL EDWARD SALAS
Reviews.Content: I ordered this RF Link to transmit the output of my VCR downstairs to my bedroom upstairs and it did the job.  I suggest that for the best possible reception, position the transmitter and receiver in areas where there is no people traffic which may interrupt the transmission.

Reviews.Title: Worked exactly as I hoped
Reviews.Author: robert
Reviews.Content: This item does exactly what it is supposed to, for me.  My extra TVs are only one room off to one side and one room off to the other side and it works great.  I am going to try one more to set up TV in the garage, so I will see what happens there as it is a bit further away, but my expectations are high.I would definitely get this if you want to transmit TV from your cable box to a TV that is in an entirely different room.

Reviews.Title: Would not work for me
Reviews.Author: redtruck38 "Red"
Reviews.Content: I hired a installation co to set up my new TV, stereo etc.They could not make it work. Had to hard wire the system.

Reviews.Title: Wireless AV sender/receiver
Reviews.Author: Robert Westfaul
Reviews.Content: Works great. I use to sends AV signals through three walls and different elevations. Connecting and setup was very easy. Would recommend to anyone to purchase.

Reviews.Title: RF Link
Reviews.Author: Mac731
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an alternative method to distribute video and audio. . CCTV camera, TV analog cable, HD camera video out only. The Transmitter and receiver were set 30 feet apart.  NOTHING WORKED . Returned to sender.

Reviews.Title: wireless av
Reviews.Author: Bob Kroon
Reviews.Content: This saved us from having to get another satellite receiver!  It really does work as advertised and the feature to use a remote is great.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Barney W "BADBARN"
Reviews.Content: Perfect for the guest room when you cannot get a cable or another dish hooked up.  Easy to install and works perfectly.  Even the remote works, which many of the more expensive devices don'[t.

Reviews.Title: Filled my unique need
Reviews.Author: Leslyn Weathers
Reviews.Content: New condo with pre-established outlets in concrete walls. The position of those outlets were not consistent for my desired TV location and this system was a simple quick solution. The challenge is that at times the communication between the sender and receiver unit is variable for changing the channels. For me it is worth it given  the walls are concrete in most areas and hardwiring would be a bear.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: BossHogg
Reviews.Content: I ordered this to connect a TV in the kitchen w/o running wires and getting another cable box. Ordered yesterday 12/27 after lunch, and with express shipping I have it up and running in less than 24 hours after ordering! Simply connected as instructions said, turned on and we are watching TV in the kitchen!!! CLEAR picture and my cable remote will work in the kitchen too!! It has to be close to the TV, but I have the receiver hidden behind the TV!! I would recommend this to ANYONE!! Just follow simple directions.

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly.
Reviews.Author: jc
Reviews.Content: Works perfectly. Bought I to replace a similar unit that failed when the transmitter got fried during a power surge.

Reviews.Title: Good but be aware of interference
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: I can send the signals through walls. I put it downstairs and can get signal in the upstairs bedroom.However, I got some issues when it is closed to a router.

Reviews.Title: No more fees
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S. Murray "JMom"
Reviews.Content: It works well and i didn't have to pay another monthly fee on a receiver!  I actually purchased another for my 'senior' mother and hers works well too with cable tv.

Reviews.Title: OK but lost clarity.
Reviews.Author: STEPHEN BROWN
Reviews.Content: For a $100 sender, the unit is good.  I was a bit disappointed tho that HD channels lost a fair amount of clarity.  I was hoping to watch NFL games in our basement where don't have a DirecTV receiver but the image quality (through the RF sender) will probably keep me watching the games on our main TV.  It's perfect for the kids shows, news programs and movies though and was easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Mitchell Bates
Reviews.Content: This is great... a little on the bulky side, but it works really good.  I can watch my TIVO from the upstairs bedroom down in my basement with little interference.

Reviews.Title: works like a charm
Reviews.Author: Postitnoter
Reviews.Content: Yahoo, now my husband can run on the treadmill without all the popping and annoying noises caused by the last audio video sender we replaced.  I think this works because of the different gigahertz but all I know is it works. We never could find what was causing the interference of the last pair but these work great.  Easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: cheap way to share
Reviews.Author: BT
Reviews.Content: works as advertised-using it between floors which it is not exactly made for but after some aiming and adjusting it does the job

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Amy M Payne
Reviews.Content: We purchased this to set up a tv in our kitchen. So far we've been pleased. We do have some interference issues when we go between the living room and kitchen a lot, but we're working out where we need to have the two signals positioned to minimize that. We also have been successful with moving the tv to our patio using the receiver still, so this certainly has met our expectations and I'm glad we purchased this unit.

Reviews.Title: Connected Anolog TV to Antenna......Inexpensive........Works Great
Reviews.Author: Leo
Reviews.Content: I purchased it to connect an outdoor antenna to an analog TV.  It worked right out of  the box with very little effort to hook it up. The mouse worked best in front of  the sensor on the converter box.  The antennas are very user friendly and easy to set up. The company website ([...]  has FAQs and pictures to supplement  instructions.Details:Here how I did it:  1.  Connected the Antenna cable to the converter box 2.  Connected the converter box to the transmitter 3.  Connected the receiver to TV. 4.  This is important because it is not illustrated in the instructions. Placed the  mouse about 2 inches in front of the SENSOR on the converter box.  (This is  important because it is not illustrated in the instructions.) 5.  Aimed the antennas toward each other. (They are very user friendly and  forgiving.) 6.  Set the video input on the TV and it worked great.Reception maybe effected by walking between the transmitter and receiver but not enough to be concerned about. Angling the antennas away from the walkway helps.My Uniden 5.8 GHZ cordless phone effects picture quality when in use.  I don't use the phone often enough to be bothered by this.Pros:InexpensiveEasy to set-upWorks right out of the boxCompany website with information on setting up the productCons:Instructions do not have a  picture or illustration showing how to setup the mouse.  The pictures are found on the company website.Overall, I think this a great product at a great price.  Just make sure to set up the mouse a couple of inches in front of the cable box, DVR or VCR sensor.

Reviews.Title: Would Definitely Purchase Again
Reviews.Author: A.N.
Reviews.Content: Purchased the AVS 5811 5.8 GHz RF Transmitter and Receiver set...was somewhat skeptical if it would work very well in my house. We wanted to move a small flatscreen TV to another location in the kitchen where there wasn't a cable jack. After receiving the set, I found it was very easy to install using the supplied RCA cables. The transmitter is located in the bedroom where our satellite receiver is located. The receiver unit is located in the kitchen approx. 40 ft. away and through 3 walls and a granite backsplash. After lining up the small flat antennas and turning both sets on, I was very, very pleased with the quality of the video and audio transmitted by these units....I think the image is equal to or better than with the cable.

Reviews.Title: These things work great
Reviews.Author: Mark & Melissa Miller
Reviews.Content: work through walls and ceilings.  About a 50 foot radius in my house.  anything more and signal quality is affected.  I am very happy with performance.

Reviews.Title: Solved my Video problem
Reviews.Author: Roger Erickson
Reviews.Content: I did not notice any interference and it sent the signal to my second HDTV crystal clear.  No more wires from my rec room setup TV to the upstairs TV.

Reviews.Title: 60 Second Setup
Reviews.Author: 2WYCE
Reviews.Content: This worked perfectly within 60 seconds of opening the box.Keep in mind, I've had the product less than one day at the time of this review, but it was so painless to get up and running, I decided to write a review now.  If anything changes my opinion of 5 stars (I hardly ever give 5 stars), I'll update this review.We had an old, half broken bunny-ears antenna hooked up before, but sometimes it worked poorly, so we decided we needed either a new antenna, or install a cable TV outlet.  While researching antennas, I came across this and decided that if it works, we'd have the best of both worlds.The transmission distance in my case is not very far, so I expected that to be a non-issue.  The transmitter is in a bedroom and the receiver is in the kitchen, which is almost directly below the bedroom.  So I'd say about 15' through the floor/ceiling.  The A/V quality is great and the remote works as if the cable box is local, even with the microwaves and all the 5.8 GHz phones & access points in the house running.  The TV it's connected to is very small (19"), so that probably helps with the quality.I was debating whether I should just get a cable outlet installed, but I thought about the fact that 97% of the time, no one is watching the bedroom TV at the same time someone is watching the kitchen TV.  For the other 3%, we can either watch the same thing or one of us can choose to watch a disc, Netflix, errr I mean Amazon Prime, or something else.  So since I don't need to get an extra cable box, I will definitely save money in the not-too-long run by not paying box rental or any other fees.  Additionally, it gives us the option to occasionally put the TV on the other side of the kitchen when we need extra space to work.  Or maybe even the garage when we hang out there (haven't tested reception there, however).I haven't yet had it long enough to definitely say I would recommend this product, but based on the ease of setup and how it's working now, I would.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Aj from CO
Reviews.Content: Without having to run new cabling in a home already constructed, this sends the signal straight through the walls to power your TV. No need for another receiver from Dish/Directv, or Comcast. Simple hook up this RF Link to your existing receiver; 10 minutes from opening the box to watching your favorite shows subscribed to.Again... Nice.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase!
Reviews.Author: Jane H.
Reviews.Content: Cleared up all the interference I had from previous RF Link! Easy to install - and I am an 80 year old g'mom.

Reviews.Title: Worked from 40ft away for 1 week...
Reviews.Author: DrewBlood
Reviews.Content: after the 1st week of working(good, not great by any stretch), it stopped getting enough signal strength to even get good audio, let alone a clear non-HD picture.  Very disappointed that the unit will not even work at this short distance.

Reviews.Title: Just one word. Amazing !
Reviews.Author: ricgomez@uniandes.edu.co
Reviews.Content: It works almost alone. I have two brick walls between the two TVs. It is located in the kitchen with a microwave, a wifi network , wireless phone an airport express. The signal on the receiving tv is perfect. And I don't have any trouble with the install procees. Not need of any kind of alignment of antennas. I connected all the equipment and it worked immediately .

Reviews.Title: RF Link not bad,  Terrible Customer support
Reviews.Author: MStewart
Reviews.Content: Pretty good product picture is fairly clear through 3 walls and about 20ft. The problem is can get the ir to work for remotely changing channels, when through all their help tips on the website and still not resolved sent a ticket to them over a week ago still no response, no  tech support ph number and still no reply!! So their product no bad but just hope you don't have to deal with any problems because you are on your own! It seems more and more of these tech websites are not hosting tech support lines and just want to respond by email whenever they feel like it usually with nothing more than a generic answer that does nothing to solve the problem! So I say Beware!!!

Reviews.Title: Good, but could be better
Reviews.Author: WKGATOR
Reviews.Content: Range isn't as good as I had expected it to be.  Also if you are transmitting HDTV it will only transmit in standard definition.  This will also cause your HDTV that this transmitter is hooked up to to be a 480 pixels instead of 1080i.  Also I don't like having to constantly plug in the cable on the receiver to get the picture to display.  Volume works good.

Reviews.Title: Worked great
Reviews.Author: B. Easter
Reviews.Content: I tried mywireless TV and it did not work it had a problem with TIVO. This one worked right out of the box no problems. Easy setup. I did not use the IR mouse, I could not get the mouse to work so I just pointed the transmitter at the Tivo box.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Melvin Thomas
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and strong signal through aluminum sided buildings.  Very satisfied and would purchase more if needed. Considering use in other places.

Reviews.Title: Not bad but signal can get lost sometimes
Reviews.Author: Ahmad Helmi Hamzah
Reviews.Content: I used the system to connect my main satellite dish transmission from the main TV room to another smaller TV in the kitchen.
