It works quite well but occasionally when you stand in-between the transmitter and the receiver, the signal will be lost and a noise is created. Need to adjust them to face each other as much as possible to reduce this. Initially, it is quite annoying but after some time I am used to it. Also, occasionally the receiver won't be receiving anything although there is no obstructions at all. I had to switch it off and on again and the signal is back on track. This also happened to the transmitter. It has 4 channels - but you need to buy extra receivers to enjoy that advantage.

Reviews.Title: it worked a little bit
Reviews.Author: Imda Booyah "booyah guy"
Reviews.Content: it worked a little bit for a little while..now it doesnt seem to work anymore. the signal was always a bit blurry and fussy with the antenna placement.  there's gotta be something better.

Reviews.Title: Hated It - Can I leave "ZERO STARS"?
Reviews.Author: Always Summertime "Lifetime Amazon Customer"
Reviews.Content: Unit didn't work.The directions were useless. Calling the company as waste of time...Their VM box is full, they don't return online requests for information. This is obviously a small company, but customer service or quality products are not important to them.BLUF....Many other reviewers had the unit fail within a short period and I now see their frustration in dealing with this company. Select another unit.

Reviews.Title: Video Transmission
Reviews.Author: Noah Paul Gregory, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I could not get this to work for me; wanted to return it but I did not try to connect it soon enough. I have had other similar devices and had no trouble; I could not get this one to connect.

Reviews.Title: Got it to work... eventually...
Reviews.Author: Steven Comeau "The Steve"
Reviews.Content: When I first hooked it up - wow, it worked immediately and very well at about 15 feet - but after about a minute, the picture & sound started to have static and then just became snowy.  I turned the transmitter part off and on, and it worked for about 2 seconds, then the signal appeared to drift out quickly.  I decided to take it apart since I thought it might be a temperature drift issue because it was hot near the back.  After I opened it up, it was very hot by the heat sink. After a bit, it started working fine again.  I then cut out the "fins" under the antenna compartment and then put the cover back on.  It did work a little while longer, but started to drift again.  After blowing on the unit, the picture & sound drifted back in again.  I decided to keep the cover off of it and because it's kind of hidden, it's not a big deal.  I might try to jerry-rig up a small laptop fan if I want the cover back on.After removing the cover permanently, I took my spare TV with the receiver to the main floor (the transmitter is hooked up to the basement FiOS box) and it worked fine through the floor.  I took it up to the 2nd floor, and after some antenna adjustment, the picture and sound is just fine.  The remote control also works fine through 2 floors (there are no walls between the floors).I bought this used for just over $60, so the warranty didn't matter and since I used to be an EE, why not try to fix it?  The remote extender cable was also broken at the tip, but I cut the cable and soldered on a new jack and now it works just fine. I actually found an old 30" LCD flat screen one day and this is hooked up to that (no HDMI), but it would be very nice if there was a system with S-Video (not necessarily HDMI which exists).  I have to admit, if they can fix the temp drift issue, this is a very nice unit.  Since FiOS also has Music Channels, I might get a spare receiver to hook up to some outdoor speakers for the summer.

Reviews.Title: Great customer service
Reviews.Author: Daniel Rieves
Reviews.Content: I love the device, it's wonderful to be able to place your TV where "YOU" want it to be. After ordering, I realized it could be purchased at a better price, Amazon was quick to match that price.

Reviews.Title: Well Done!
Reviews.Author: dgfla
Reviews.Content: Pro's: This is a big upgrade over the 2.4ghz Terk LF30S unit I replaced this with. Signal is so strong that I can even now hide this below the TV, where as the old Terk unit had to be mounted almost at line of sight. No more waiting for microwave to be finished before I could resume viewing the TV.Con's: Would be nice if the Remote control cable was longer, this one is about 18in which can be limiting. Also these units have a very bright Red LED even when the unit is not in use, will have to see over time if this is problematic.Overall very happy with this device.

Reviews.Title: Great to work with...
Reviews.Author: Michael H. Down
Reviews.Content: Product was just as advertised..Was shipped on time and was packaged correctly. Easy to follow instruction...hooked the transmitter up in the spare room.

Reviews.Title: It works well
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Espinosa V
Reviews.Content: Installing it is very simple, but you have to do connect it via RCA's. Unfortunately it does not have any other connection like coaxial, HDMI, etc. The unit is not that small, but it will fit in most places.You can switch channels through the remote IR which is a very good feature. Keep in mind you have to keep the infrared 'mouse" in front of the receiver in order to be able to use your cable remote through the system.It does not have the claimed dictance of 400 feet, but it does a very good job comparing it with similar products that usually have extremely low signal range.All in all, it does a very good job as long as you don't get your expectations too high.

Reviews.Title: RF Link AVS 5811
Reviews.Author: Doris Hill
Reviews.Content: This is a handy item to own. I use it to watch TV in my bed room and the only complaint I have is that I have to go into the living room to change channels.

Reviews.Title: Works...sorta
Reviews.Author: M. Lawson
Reviews.Content: This does transmit audio/video, but going across a 15' room with no obstructions, I wouldn't expect flickering and static. Either standard def or high def, both flicker too often for my liking. I had purchased this to avoid having to drill holes in my walls to run cable to a portion of the room where these isn't any easy access. We can watch TV, but it certainly isn't uninterrupted...I don't know how it compares to other products since I've never owned anything like this before. Maybe they all have this interference, but if so I can't see how this would ever be a popular solution.UPDATE: I ended up running cable along the baseboard across the room because the video quality was so poor I couldn't take it anymore. If anyone walked around the room in front of the sending/receiving units forget about it. And even uninterrupted the flickering was horrible. So now these are in the garage on a shelf taking up space...probably never to be used again. I don't even feel comfortable selling these to anyone because I'd feel like I was robbing them. Changed my ranking from a 3 star to a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Nate Sahl
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's doing, I don't know much about these things. But he says he has no complaints and never had issues with it.

Reviews.Title: Worked great
Reviews.Author: Skywise
Reviews.Content: Had this hooked up and running 24/7 for a little over 3 years until the transmitter died (possibly due to an area wide power failure, although it was plugged into a surge suppressor and I've gone through several power failures this spring already without incident before.)  I live in an apartment and had it hooked up to my DVR in the living room and transmitting to my bedroom with a clear line of sight about 100 feet away.  The 5.8ghz band didn't interfere with my 5ghz band 802.11ac router broadcasts and I had good signal connectivity.  I had the 2.4 ghz equivalent before but the transmission was constantly being interrupted by all the 802.11g wifi activity around my apartment building.  About the only time I had a signal problem was when I was physically between the antennae.(Note the transmitter and receiver antenna are directional and rotatable and you'll want them pointing directly at each other for best performance/range)The downside to these is that they only support standard definition (SD) signals (requiring me to keep changing my DVR output to 480i instead of 1080i) and while there's a switch to turn them off it's a nuisance to do so and they'll end up staying on 24/7.The downsides are minor, however and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend them.  For me, however, I moved ahead to an HDMI (and more expensive) repeater - IOGEAR GW3DHDKIT Wireless 3D Digital Kit with Full HD 1080P and 5.1 Channel Digital Audio

Reviews.Title: Did the job
Reviews.Author: DHD
Reviews.Content: Needed to send the TV signal from one side of a large room to the other. This product did the job but was a bit more difficult that expected to set it up. Encountered problems with the reception end, it was being interferred with by the emissions of the TV and then TV ears device. Once that was overcome then the IR repeater at the transmission end was a little pickey as to where it was placed in relation to the transmitter. At the end, it does work and I am pleased with the product. The biggest negative is that when a screen, always during a commerical, has a lot of white displayed, the video is distorted until a different screen is displayed. Not being a fan of commericals this is only a distraction to me. I would buy this product again.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good picture
Reviews.Author: J. W. Cotton
Reviews.Content: I got this to send the signal from a DTV DVR in my wife's sewing room to an older tv at her craft center in the basement.  She does not have HDTV on either (which she doesn't want).  The only problem is when the antennas are not aligned properly.  The picture flicks and pops until switching channels and realigning the antennas.  The two sets are about 50' apart with three walls in between.  Overall, it does a good job especially considering there is no other way to get the wires into the basement.

Reviews.Title: Good Connection But Not Always
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Coburn "RAC"
Reviews.Content: Transmission through an attic roof to a window of a den, a distance of ~100 ft was very good.However, a power interruption would cause the camera's transmitter to switch from channel 1 to channel 2 upon restoration of power.Thus, connection was not possible as the receiver was still on channel 1.  Work around by setting both to channel 2 to begin with.Don't know what you would do if you plan on using all 4 channels

Reviews.Title: Good NON HD transmitter
Reviews.Author: w a brannon
Reviews.Content: Can not beat it for the moneyLine of sight 20 feet works perfictlyeasy installwould buy it again

Reviews.Title: Works as Advertised
Reviews.Author: Roberto
Reviews.Content: Installation was easy and worked when powered up.  Everything you needed to install included.  Only had it a month no issues so far.

Reviews.Title: Better than running wires
Reviews.Author: Quentin W. Douglas "Qman"
Reviews.Content: This is better than running wires if possible. Just try to limit how much its going through. The receiver and transmitter are about 20 feet apart and it goes through our upstairs hardwood floor and our living room ceiling which is plaster and lathe. We have no problems. Picture and sound is great.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: C2CO
Reviews.Content: I like it.  It does the job.  Sends a TV signal through three interior walls 50' away.  As long as nobody moves around the signal is pretty solid.  Tends to go a bit fuzzy and static'y if people walk between the transmitter and receiver.  No interference with any other wireless products noted.  A good, inexpensive, wireles solution for sending a TV signal around the house.  I've used it for several months.

Reviews.Title: I returned it.
Reviews.Author: AMC
Reviews.Content: Did not work as I had hoped.  Reception faded in and out.  Tried it in different areas and it did not improve.

Reviews.Title: Terrific!
Reviews.Author: CRAIGML
Reviews.Content: Works beautifully with DirectV HD! Took 5 minutes from unpacking through setup to watching TV!!!  Definitely a winner! Simple to set up and learn to use!

Reviews.Title: worked as advertised!!  Great price and great delivery!
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I am only using it for audio transmission to enable use of ear buds.in living room.  works great for that.

Reviews.Title: Works great under certain conditions
Reviews.Author: Jonathan M. Hanson
Reviews.Content: This product works great if there are no large amounts of metal (ie. furnace ducting, etc) on the line of sight between transmitter and receiver. This requirement was not satisfied on my first try. The transmitter in basement and receiver in kitchen. There was tremendous noise both in audio and video but particularly audio. Lots of "popping" sounds. The metal is probably serving as an antenna for ambient EM noise and retransmitting that to the receiver unit. Distance between transmitter and receiver was approx 40'. I moved the remote TV/receiver into the livingroom where distance was reduced to maybe 15' and no metal structures in between. Works great. Sound and video is good. Video is not HD but still very acceptable. This product may also interfere with wireless phones...my caller ID does not work on the wireless phones now but does work on the hard-wired phones. I am experimenting with this now.I would say that this is an inexpensive alternative to running coax in a house but do not expect it to work well in all situations.

Reviews.Title: Works well on standard TV-Not so good on HD
Reviews.Author: Steve C.
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit to extend my satellite audio/video to the kitchen area.  It produced a wavy video picture on the 20" flat screen  HD TV.  I swapped the HD TV for similar size not HD flat screen I had and the picture is perfect, no distortion.  I'm not sure if the problem is with the specific HD TV I tried it on or not.  I did turn off all other electronics in the area to try and eliminate any external interference source but it did not help.  The picture on the non HD TV is fine and the range is good.

Reviews.Title: Great option to watch tv in multiple rooms/garage
Reviews.Author: Ronald L. McAtee
Reviews.Content: System gives great picture and sound in any room without having to rent another satellite or cable box monthly.  Good stuff.

Reviews.Title: happy
Reviews.Author: buyer x
Reviews.Content: solved my signal strength problem, and don't even have to be aligned.  the 5.8 GHz solved all my interference problems and I can use my favourite cordless phone at home.

Reviews.Title: Good solution to an old house problem
Reviews.Author: Steve Doty
Reviews.Content: I wanted to move my television from a corner of the room, where there was a cable connection, to the middle of the room where ther was not one. Did a little research, bought it, and like it alot. It works very well with our Dish TV set up. Picture is not "HD" perfect quality but more than acceptable for me. Only drawback is the red power light that stays on but a piece of electical tape took care of that issue.

Reviews.Title: This works perfect!
Reviews.Author: Kathy L. Young
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how clear and sharp the transmission is.  The transmitter looks so small, but works like a giant!  Thanks!  I would definitely recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: Really works
Reviews.Author: J. Taylor "fan"
Reviews.Content: I already had an AV transmitter/receiver for my small kitchen TV because it is too small an area for any cable box.  I send the TV content from the cable box in the basement that is not used very often.  There was so much interference on my old system that I thought it worth it to try this one.  Works great.  The interference is gone and we can watch TV while the microwave is running.  No problem.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't get this to work
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Dion
Reviews.Content: I'm not technologically adept, so, even though the Ad promised that this would be easy to set up & use, I was unable to get it up & running.

Reviews.Title: Great for Direct TV
Reviews.Author: Tinamarie
Reviews.Content: I use this for the garage.  I don't need to rent another box, I have the transmitter on our bedroom box that no one used during the day.

Reviews.Title: Somewhat worked for year until complete failure.
Reviews.Author: cgstatenj
Reviews.Content: Setup from bedroom located at back of house to outdoor Tiki bar approx 30 feet away.  Upon first installing was able to link up signal from bedroom.  Most of issues was with remote.  Sometimes it worked.  Eventually it would never work.  Signal weaken and after 2nd year was total useless even when positioning the devices 20ft apart in same room.  Outside use had direct line of site through window.

Reviews.Title: This is a VERY Good Product!
Reviews.Author: Dave E. Schnuckel
Reviews.Content: I have satellite TV in my home and it would be almost impossible to run the satellite dish input to my TV set in the bedroom.  For years I used the older RF Link 2.4 Ghz transmitter which worked just fine.  After some 10 years of 24/7 operation it gave up the ghost.  I found the 5.8 Ghz transmitter receiver combo here for a reasonable price and purchased it.  I was quite leery of such a high frequency transmitter as they tend to have not such a good track record for non line-of-sight reception, and I am shooting this signal some 45 feet through 5 walls in the house.  Boy, was I surprised!  This system looks and sounds great!  Keep in mind that this system only works with Standard Definition TV signals, not High Definition, which is fine for my application.  Maybe there is a newer model out that does transmit and receive HD, I don't know.  I would not hesitate to recommend this transmitter receiver combo to anyone.Dave

Reviews.Title: Good system
Reviews.Author: Jack P.Connell
Reviews.Content: Much  better than lower frequency sysstem I previously had.  Very sensitive to pointing angle.  Had to adjust it several times to eliminate intermittent interference.  No problem with microwave operating in close proximity.

Reviews.Title: Works Perfect
Reviews.Author: TV Junkie
Reviews.Content: I didn’t have high hopes when I ordered this item because of past bad experiences with wireless video devices. I was very surprised when after a very simple hookup it worked perfectly. The video and sound quality is perfect. I’m transmitting DirectTV from the basement to an upstairs bedroom. It’s as if the DirectTV box was in the bedroom. The DirectTV remote works perfect in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: works very good
Reviews.Author: W. Terrell
Reviews.Content: After carefully lining up the antenna, so they point at each other, the units perform very good. Using this allows me to have one less cable box.

Reviews.Title: This is awesome
Reviews.Author: Low Blood Sugar
Reviews.Content: I used it in audience participation theater performance to film the crowd transmit the video to a projector.  Instead of using the wall outlet for power, I rigged a 9v battery to it and it worked great!  I had a small ammount of transmission interference, but that is to be expected.

Reviews.Title: Excellent condition.
Reviews.Author: Paul E Zewin
Reviews.Content: I have it for for year then no problem at all. I use it for dish and living room from master bed room and very nice picture.

Reviews.Title: Met Expectations
Reviews.Author: bludvl
Reviews.Content: Works well with direct line sight. Not such good reception when going through walls. Overall, satisfied with performance. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: This is our third RF Link
Reviews.Author: P. Roberts
Reviews.Content: This system works wonders in our home.  The first one we bought lasted 7 years.  We just replaced it with another one then decided to get the next one for our other two tv's.  The ability of mixing or matching works for us.  Would recommend to anyone , pays for itself in no time.

Reviews.Title: Excellent wireless option!
Reviews.Author: Simple Life "Love Life"
Reviews.Content: This solution helps us watch tv in our master bedroom which is on the second floor, well away from the transmitter.  We have the dish two tv option, so using the wireless works great.  We change channels through the dish box's second tv remote. The remote control option on the transmitter does not catch the signal from the remote, but, this does not matter to us.  No cables or paying someone to move the existing cable point in the wall.

Reviews.Title: Wire cutter
Reviews.Author: Claire
Reviews.Content: I found the reviews on Amazon very helpful, and I'm glad I read them. Otherwise, I would have been very skeptical when I opened the package. The sender and receiver are little plastic units. They did not look like the high-tech number I was expecting. However, I trusted other positive assessments I had read and went about connecting everything. This was very easy to install, even though I am a technophobe (all you have to do is plug in). The only thing that I have not figured out is how to still enable HDTV. Otherwise, it's delightful.It iss very liberating to be able to rearrange my living room without having to worry about where my cable outlets are. I can put the TV anywhere!

Reviews.Title: Poorly made
Reviews.Author: Paul M. Workentine
Reviews.Content: Purchased this from Amazon.  Worked great the first 2 times I used it. Then the receiving unit died for no obvious reason.  Waste of money to purchase an item that works for only 2 hours.

Reviews.Title: This just works
Reviews.Author: D Hooks
Reviews.Content: I needed a wireless solution to avoid running yet another cable approximately 60 feet through 4 walls. Plugged in the transmitter, aimed he antenna, plugged in the receiver and voila! Great signal quality and I've yet to encounter any interference issues.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with signal quality
Reviews.Author: Brunello
Reviews.Content: Despite having a very robust wireless system in my house, picture quality is not what I expected.Pros:Easy to set up.Cons:Picture quality is only fair.Three stars. Not as good as expected.

Reviews.Title: Annoying interference
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: I use this device to relay audio and video from my surveillance system in the basement to the TV in my family room. Don't use it often and it serves it's purpose, but it's nowhere near as good as a physical A/V cable. The receiver and transmitter are only 30 feet apart (transmitting through walls and floor - but certainly in the stated range) and I get very annoying, intermittent static that would really prevent me from using this with any kind of continuous use like watching television or a movie. Switching channels doesn't help. I can't tell if it's a defect or interference but I am likely returning it.

Reviews.Title: RF Link AVS-5811
Reviews.Author: SBuyer
Reviews.Content: Purchased this unit to transmit TV signal from the second to a first floor. Signal gets transmitted however the quality is really poor. If somebody walk in the area close to sender or receiver, it results in a lot off noise to the TV signal. Every time I used this unit, I had to adjust antenna a little bit to get a better sound quality. In summary, better then nothing, but don't expect this unit provide you stable and reliably signal.

Reviews.Title: Great unit for the price
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Mcguire "hotmike"
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this item, works great. The picture and sound are not perfect , but I can live with it

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Blake A. Roach "-Blake A. Roach"
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with what I purchased. I needed it for a upcoming job, and got everything I needed quickly. I would recommend this again. Thanks a lot.

Reviews.Title: Be sure to read if you have any older models of this rf link
Reviews.Author: Dollhunter "Diana"
Reviews.Content: I need to give some background because this will help others in my situation.  I wrote in the "discussions forum" (Aug,2012), but never wrote about what happened when I bought the second sender-receiver set."I bought my first RF-Link sender and receiver in Aug of 2009. It worked perfectly, and since, I have bought three other receivers, all working well. I do have a tv in a guest bedroom, and when someone is staying there, I move one of the receivers. OK. I decided this summer to buy another for that room, and when it came, it didn't have that little stick antenna on it, and didn't work. I tried it at all existing receiver locations, which I know work, and it didn't. I even moved a little tv to the room the sender is in, and no luck, so I returned it. I bought one then on Ebay. They were using a stock photo, but when it came, it didn't have the antenna, and didn't work either. Now, I am thinking that if I buy the sender-receiver combo (the photo shows antennas on both) for about $20 more, I'll get a receiver with an antenna. Would someone who has recently (within the last couple months) bought the set check if the stick antenna is on the receiver? Thanks"Well, the new set also doesn't have antenna sticks, and when I replaced my 2009 sender with the new one, the new transmitter would not send a pix to  any of the three 2009 receivers, so if you already have ones with antennas, I think it is important for you to know they are not compatible.I did solve the problem though.. I put my DVD recorder in another room, and connected the 2009 receiver to it, ran an HDMI cord to the tv, so I had a picture on that tv,  and connected the new transmitter to the OUT holes (red white yellow) of the recorder, so one set-up  has both a 2009 receiver and a 2012 transmitter on  it, and everything is now working fine. I have been very happy with the system and recommend it to anyone, but if you already own some antenna (old) ones, know that the two are not compatible.

Reviews.Title: More than expected!
Reviews.Author: Stretch
Reviews.Content: Came packed well in bubble wrap and earlier than expected. As an added bonus there was an additional receiver included.

Reviews.Title: Works Great!
Reviews.Author: rc "Adopt a shelter pet PetFinder."
Reviews.Content: Moved from old 2.4 GHz due to interference. These 5.8GHz work great as I hoped. I am completely satisfied at this time. Hopefully they last as long as the ones I previously had.  The lights on them are really bright.  Not good for a dark room.  May need to cover the lights if it's too bright for you.

Reviews.Title: Great when it works, but stops working after a year or so
Reviews.Author: Houston mom "I love witty, fast-paced books t...
Reviews.Content: We have a TV in the kitchen that can't be wired due to its location. We found this transmitter about 5 years ago, and have had TV ever since. About 3 1/2 years in, the picture started to degrade. We found that if we turned off the transmitter, it worked for awhile until it got hot, then got snowy again. We liked the product so well, we purchased a replacement. Unfortunately, this one has only lasted a bout a year, so I'm looking for another brand. Caution to anyone purchasing this type of transmitter-- make sure you get a 5.8 Ghz model. The 2.4 Ghz models never get a clear picture if you have wireless phones or computers.

Reviews.Title: Works great ...No problems
Reviews.Author: Kratano
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and works great so I can watch Direct TV in my office without paying the $5 a month for another receiver.. Just hooked up to my master bedroom TV and BOOM...Can watch TV in my office !!!!

Reviews.Title: Near Perfection
Reviews.Author: Private Citizen
Reviews.Content: Right out of the box, plugged in and working within 10 minutes. In use in a basement where there were no other good options for a TV in a home gym. Video and audio is clear. IR remote works as described.Very pleased as we used to string a coax cable across the floor of two other rooms. Why not try it yourself? If it does not work for you, return it. You've got nothing to lose. Also, if you're not an Amazon Prime member you should be.

Reviews.Title: Hard to rate:  remote extender doesn't work, but may be interference from router
Reviews.Author: dk
Reviews.Content: updated 07/18/2012:  purchased a similar product from Shoptronics:  Nyrius NY-GS3200 5.8GHz 6 Channel Wireless Audio/Video Sender Transmitter & Receiver System with IR Remote Extender, and had the same issue with the remote control not working.  Unlike the RF-Link, these guys actually have a customer service department, they mentioned there may be interference with our modem for internet, since both units were next to each other.  They suggested moving the modem, but since we returned it we unfortunately won't be able to test out this theory.I have my DirecTV receiver set up in the living room, and wanted to transmit the signal to the bedroom tv down the hall (a mere 50ft away).  The unit was super simple to set up, and the signal worked fine the first time.  But regardless of how far or close I place the remote extender/mouse, the remote will not work in the bedroom.  Not sure what the issue is, and after digging through all of these reviews, I couldn't find a solution that worked.  I'll be sending this back tomorrow.  Big disappointment!

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Mr.Anderson
Reviews.Content: I have mine hooked up to a "Fish TV" camera outside on the boat dock, now i can check the camera from my main tv before running out there.

Reviews.Title: beyond it limits
Reviews.Author: beyondhelpin
Reviews.Content: I tried the unit and had marginal success. My needs were beyond its capablities. At 115' and thru 5 walls it just could not provide a good picture. It was very grainy. The remote repeater worked well though. The 2.4ghz repeaters would not show a picture at all. This kind of suprised me as the lower band should pass thru walls easier than a 5.8ghz should. I guess the distance was to much for the lower band. Looks like it is going to have to be wired considering the long distance and the number of walls for me to have sat in my shop. I returned the unit.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Disappointing
Reviews.Author: Gerald Pauly
Reviews.Content: I have used a similar device from Radio Shack for years.  But my old relay had its antenna busted which hurt the picture quality.  I ordered this as a replacement.Sitting in the exact same spot this RF-Link was worse than my 4 year old broken antenna Radio Shack.  The distance was 12 feet with a single sheet rock / 2x4 interior wall between them.  All on the same floor.I'm just going to drill a hole in the wall and run coax.

Reviews.Title: Does exactly what it claims...
Reviews.Author: z28cowboy
Reviews.Content: I'm really glad I purchased this model.  Of the 4 radio signal channels this unit transmits, one of them works perfect with no interference at all from other household wireless devices.  Well worth the price in it's ease of installation when compared to the alternative of routing wires and cables through a wall!

Reviews.Title: Works great - fabulous receptoin
Reviews.Author: John Sellinger
Reviews.Content: I had previously ordered a similar product that didn't work, I guess because of interference.  The 5.8GHz channeling solves all of those problems.  It is easy to set up and easier to work.  If you want to send video from one tv to another and avoid the cost of a cable box or video adapter, this is the ticket.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good yet not so good
Reviews.Author: Amanda Dixon
Reviews.Content: So I've had this for about a month now.  It's used to broadcast from a DirecTV box.  I've tried it with 2 different TV's with mixed results.Broadcasting to a TV approx 25 feet away, and a floor down, it actually works pretty well.  There's a slight delay with the IR receiver/sender, but on the whole I'm quite impressed by it, especially given it's going through the floor with no line of sight.Swapping it to TV#2 wasn't so good.  This TV is maybe 45 feet away, but is almost line of sight.  Standing at the unit it is relatively easy to get a good picture and if you go and sit down in front of the TV it works like TV#1.  However if someone walks through that "line of sight" between the units, then the picture will flicker and pop, just like a set of rabbit ears.  Closing a door also seems to affect it.  It really does seem to operate like an antenna rather than a wireless sender/receiver - very open to disruption.I also want to add that the antenna's are very flimsy.  The plastic on my sender broke pretty much straight out the box and I now have a lovely printed circuit board sticking up in the air.Finally, I agree with others regarding the aesthetics and the glowing red "eye of sauron".  Not pretty.So it'll go back in my basement and work fine.  I considered buying another for the main floor, but based on my experiences I'll not be doing that.

Reviews.Title: plug and play in less than 1 minute
Reviews.Author: tomedyan
Reviews.Content: I usually don't like to write reviews, but I will make an exception for this one because it worked so well and I wanted to share it so others can benefit from this product.  For years, I longed for a TV in the Kitchen so I can watch something while cooking.  I kicked myself many times for not installing a cable outlet in the kitchen when we built our house.  When we decided to remodel the kitchen recently, the idea of fishing the cable from basement and cutting through the cabinet and walls came up.  However, it was so much work it's almost not worth it.  I acidentally discovered a wireless transmitter like this one in Best Buy, so I started researching online.  I finally decided on this model because it's relatively inexpensive and seemed to meet my needs.  After reading some of the negative reviews, my expectations were quite low. Once I receive the product, I was able to quickly install it with the cables that came with it, and I got near perfect picture and sound instantly. The manaul was quite basic like many people mentioned, but you really don't need it because there are only a few AV cables to plug.Here are some details about my experience so far after about 1-month usage:1. my set up did not involve going through walls.  The receiver and transimitter are about 20' from the family room to kitchen.  It does not matter whether the little antennas are pointed toward each other or not2. The cable box from my cable company already has the AV output plugs for the transmitter. I did not have to turn on the main TV to watch the remote TV in the kitchen.  Certain TV channels tend to show frequent static sounds which can be quite annoying, but other channels are fine at the same time.3. With the re-modeling in the kitchen going on, I had to remove the receiver and TV a few times.  All it took was unplug two electrical plugs and it took less than 10 secounds.Overall, I'm VERY happy with the results, especially considering it came with so little work and so inexpensively comparing to the alternative - instally the hard wired cable!

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Randall Catalano
Reviews.Content: This device works as advertised and it was very easy to set it up.  I was mistaken to think that it would support multiple remote ends, but it's a one-to-one device with a choice of 4 codes.  The very bright red power LED is annoying, however.

Reviews.Title: worth the money
Reviews.Author: syam
Reviews.Content: Bought this item to overcome the hassle of cable wiring of my second TV. Got the product in time set up was a breeze. Worked well as well as transmisson of TV signals but IR remote is not usefull at all. The TV signal get grains when some thing block in between the sender and reciever but only at a certain line between them. But clarity wise it is good. Worth the money I had paid for

Reviews.Title: Video Transmission
Reviews.Author: Hoppy
Reviews.Content: Works great for me. I only had a about 20 feet between tvs, but sound and video work great.Remote works, I'm very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Worked great - On a different channel
Reviews.Author: D. Lewis
Reviews.Content: I finally broke down and got cable service.  We installed DirectTV a couple of weeks ago.  I wanted TV in my wife's sewing room, but it's next to impossible to get a cable to that room.  Decided to try this RF-Link product.My transmitter is in the south side of 2nd story house.  The reveiver is on north side main level.  Signal goes through 2-3 walls and floor.  At first, there were statically lines and sound cackle.  Rotated and couldn't get it to go away.  Turned off other wireless devices and got no improvement.  Then I remembered that there were four channels.  I moved from channel 1 to 2.  Same static.  Moved both switches to channel 4 it worked like a charm.  Couldn't be better.  I like the way the remote control works from the local TV, through the receiver/transmitter, to the "mouse" and then to the DirectTV box.

Reviews.Title: unreliable piece of.....
Reviews.Author: R44chopper "chopper"
Reviews.Content: I bought this a couple years ago, when there was no alternative.I got one transmitter, and 3 receivers.Every week or so, when nothing has changed, I needed to change to another channel to get it to work right.When someone walks in the wrong place, the picture would go wonky, and sound was lost.The transmitter quit after a year or so, and I bought another.This week, that one broke.I've been fighting with this thing for a  couple years.So, I just bought the Nyrius, and it works better with the first plug in than this one worked ever.Better picture, better stability.Good bye RF Link, I won't miss you.....

Reviews.Title: Absolutely wonderful
Reviews.Author: Cricket's Mom
Reviews.Content: I recently began using my downstairs family room and bought a TV for it.  I have a satellite dish and unfortunately there is no cable outlet downstairs.  I figured I'd have to either pay through the nose for another receiver and wiring or settle for just watching TV through Roku.  I saw this on Amazon and decided to give it a try.  It was a breeze to set up and I've experienced no problems whatsoever.  Until today I didn't think the IR repeater worked; it finally dawned on me that I needed to use the remote that works via UHF, not the line-of-sight one I'd been trying to use.  Totally worth the money; I am so pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Great system
Reviews.Author: banana62
Reviews.Content: Needed this system to get TV out to my hot tub.  Hooked it up to the composite output on my Comcast Hi-Def DVR.  After a little tuning between the two antennas and choosing the correct channel, it works great.  Picture on a 24" LCD is excellent and the sound is also pretty good.  I have it running about 40 feet through one brick and two plaster walls.  The only time I get any noticeable interference is when someone walks between the antennas inside my house.  The ability to control the Comcast box through the IR mouse is a great feature.  I highly recommend this unit to anyone that needs TV services and cabling is just too much of a hassle.

Reviews.Title: good value for money
Reviews.Author: J. Katz
Reviews.Content: We purchased this product more than a year ago and we never had an issue with the quality of audio and video signals. We sometimes have to readjust the antenna because our cat likes to throw things of tables including the rf-link receiver. It is a great product if you want to watch cable television on more than one TV with one remote. Only rarely do we need to turn off the transmission system to reset it.

Reviews.Title: As good as $500 Belkin Wireless AV
Reviews.Author: cdpham
Reviews.Content: I had the Belkin wireless AV which I bought for $500 but it stopped working after 3 years.  I was looking for a replacement and was worried that the much cheaper RF-Links AVS would not have as good picture quality and as good range but it quelched my worries.  The unit is awesome.  It performs the same as the Belkin product or better and at five time cheaper in price.

Reviews.Title: Nice signal strength
Reviews.Author: Scott Finley
Reviews.Content: I've had this product for a couple of months.  The signal strength is better than I was expecting.  I have 2 receivers with one transmitter and have them in different rooms.  One is on the same floor as the transmitter and is positioned about 30 feet away and one is in my basement, about 20 feet. Both are clear signals with very little noise. There are walls and floors in between so I'm impressed.  This transmits my satellite signal to other televisions so I don't have to pay $10 per month per tv for another receiver. This is well worth the investment.

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: great product
Reviews.Content: great product works great on my computer with av transformer, crisp picture fast setting do recommend this prodcut to any person that likes to use internet clips and movies o watch on tv

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: Had a different system and it didn't work very good. This system works really great. I would recommend it very highly.

Reviews.Title: Great Problem Solver
Reviews.Author: gt3386b
Reviews.Content: I bought this after discovering that Directv could not run a cable to my kitchen.  With a brand new TV and no ability to receive programming, I was very frustrated...until I found this!  Installing took less than ten minutes--with three children under five trying to "help"--and the image quality is quite nice.  I only wish it could connect via HDMI rather than through AV.

Reviews.Title: Best product for ease of use Picture/Sound clarity and price.
Reviews.Author: wesley
Reviews.Content: I am about to buy my second unit as the first worked better than expected for RCA cable hookup. I did not want to pay for another Direct TV receiver for my outdoor patio TV but I did want great picture quality as the patio unit is a 1080P LG. Well I got the RF link on Friday and hooked it up in about 10 minutes, most of that time was getting to the source (Direct TV) unit moved so I could hook up the RCA connection behind it. Wow. Near perfect picture and really good sound quality for what I have (TV only speakers) on the patio. I am not sure how it would have worked if  you are looking to extend the sound to a a high end sound quality unit but the TV sound is perfect.I am buying another unit for my theater as it does not have a TV signal(direct tv). only DVD/CD and the receiver (radio). I will revise the post once I hook it up there as I have an onkyo unit and 7.1 surround sound.I love that you can operate the source unit remotely with this as well. some people are disappointed that they cannot watch two different programs on the two units simultaneously , well this is not meant for that. This is only for Video/Audio transfer. I will be reducing the number of Direct TV units as we do not use all the rooms/units at once.  so that $5.99 per month savings will pay for these units in about 6 months. I am not sure about the life of these units so I am turning them off when not in use.

Reviews.Title: Directv Anywhere!
Reviews.Author: Scott Lewis Korn "cycling DO"
Reviews.Content: RF-Link AVS-5811 5.8GHz Audio and Video Transmission System with IR RepeaterEasy set up.  Works great.  IR repeater allows you to take directv remote in extra room with you.  good picture quality on 21' LCD.

Reviews.Title: Great for Projector!
Reviews.Author: rjstaggs
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for one reason only. I needed to wirelessly connect my DVD, PS2, PS3, WII, to my ceiling mounted projector, without running wires. Using an AV switch and the RF-Link, it worked wonderfully. Very simple setup. If you can plug a cord into an outlet and hookup an AV cable (Yellow, Red, White), then you can set you can set this up easily. I used an AV switch with mine, so I can run multiple devices to the transmitter. Works great if you are only looking to broadcast standard definition. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: rdlma
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Ames
Reviews.Content: RF-Link AVS-5811 5.8GHz Audio and Video Transmission System with IR RepeaterWill not work without signal interference if you have a 5.8 Ghz phone system or wireless router. Works fine with these items unplugged but that defeats the purpose of using these systems.

Reviews.Title: it's not perfect, but it is a practical solution.
Reviews.Author: jorod74
Reviews.Content: read reviews and gave this product a shot. after all, i planned to use it to only bridge about 12 feet in a room with no barriers between the transmitter and receiver.it's a moody little box; some days, picture quality is great. others, it looks like my cable is being picked up by rabbit ears on the back of the TV. The packaging says it has a range of 300 feet, and through walls. i am not quite sure about those claims. in the age of BlueTooth and other wireless devices, a simple transceiver like this should be near flawless at short ranges (less than 20 feet, anyway.)i say this because i have an app on my phone that allows me to watch video/listen to music from my computer at home wirelessly from 30=50 feet out no pronlems, or from anywhere in the world via internet connection. so this device should be better, being it is working on a simpler, easier concept.Sound quality has always been perfect.lastly, the seller here was fantastic and i won't fault them for delivering their product in a swift, reliable manner. it's just the product fell a notch short of what i expected.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Device
Reviews.Author: Alan L. Taylor "SmokerAl"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this to allow my wife to watch cable channels we receive in the family room on the digital receiveron her kitchen TV. This thing is truly simple to use. It was a virtual plug n play. It worked great the first time, did what she wanted and most importantly my wife is happy!

Reviews.Title: Up and going in a few minutes with great picture
Reviews.Author: skwrek
Reviews.Content: Ok this is my first review on Amazon.I purchased this because I wanted to have access to my satellite in another room without having to run a coax cable and pay for another satellite receiver.  And I wanted to be able to change rooms very easily.I was hoping for a good picture and reasonable responsiveness with the remote using the remote extender feature.I just received the product today, and the TV I wanted to test with was in my sleeping childs room, so I decided to first use a TV I had stored in the basement.  So I set up the transmitter in the entertainment center in my living room.  By far the majority of the set up time was running the power cord to the power strip and luckily I had video and audio component cables already run.  So plugged in the power and the video/audio cables, turned it on. Then carried the receiver, video/audio cables (included with the product), power supply and headed to the basement.  Then powered up the TV, the receiver, plugged in the video/audio cables, and turned to video1 on the TV.  And there was the picture and audio!  And it looked like I was watching TV in the living room.  It was crisp and clear.  Grant it, the distance from transmitter to receiver is not very far, probably only 30ft at most.So then it was time to test the remote extender, so I first pointed the transmitter at the two components I wanted to control from the remote, and brought down the remote to the basement, pointed it at the receiver, and immediately the channel changed.  Both components were controlled just as if I was pointing the remote directly at them.  So now I could turn on my stereo receiver and satellite receiver and change channels.So the final test was using the IR mouse so I could  hide away the transmitter in my entertainment center and drop the IR mouse down the front to hopefully be able to transmit the IR to both components, without being too conspicuous  Again it worked perfectly.  I have accomplished exactly what I wanted.Tomorrow, I will try the actual TV I want to use with the transmitter/receiver pair.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Detailed Buyer
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the RF-Link AVS-5811 5.8GHz Audio and Video Transmission System with IR Repeater from Amazon.com. It was very easy to set up with my satellite box. I use my satellite remote to change the channels on the receiver TV. I am very pleased with the video quality and sound. It saved me time and effort of running wires from room to room.  Great buy and good price.

Reviews.Title: Worked for me!,  and IR repeater fantastic !
Reviews.Author: A JUAREZ ALVAREZ "AJA"
Reviews.Content: After I make a deep research, I decided for this that was an affordable video transmiter solution and it was what I expected, the Video Quality and sound are very good.  I have WIFI and wireless 5 Ghz phones and do not have any interference problem.the cable wiring was giving me a little interference when I connect it, but after I organize all my wiring the interference go away.Something that I don't expected was the IR Remote control sensitivity, it is Great!. Since my wife wanted the module to be hide, I put the receiver module just behind my LCD 32" TV, I though I was going to have problems with the remote control, but guess what?! The remote control reception was sucessfull !  even when the module was behind the TV, isn't great?!So, I recommend this as an affordable video transmiter solution.

Reviews.Title: The system works flawlessly
Reviews.Author: purchasor
Reviews.Content: I installed the system in about 10 minutes and it has been running without a glitch.The rooms are separated about 30 feet with cinder block walls in between and the picture and audio is flawless.Compared with other products this system has the advantage because of the 5.8 ghz frequency.The documentation is skimpy and consists of a single sheet of paper... But you will not need to read it...

Reviews.Title: Wow, very easy to setup and use
Reviews.Author: MikeMac "MikeMac"
Reviews.Content: Having just remodeled part of the house, the last thing I wanted to do was drill holes trying to fish coax cable.  Currently I'm using this in a spare bedroom while my mother-in-law stays with us to recover and I'll eventually be moving it to a different room.  This was super easy to setup, had it up and running within 10 minutes without the need for reading the directions.  If you do need the directions, they are very easy to follow.How I currently have this setup is I have the cable box that is generating the signal in my bedroom and the receiver in the spare bedroom.  The signal going through the walls and doors is very clear and the sound is not distorted at all.  If you do get any interference there are other channels that you can change to if needed.The only input/output on both the transceiver and receiver are RCA.  I have a small cable box that I'm using that my cable company provided when all broadcasts were moved to digital and the only output on the box is coax.  How I got around it is I'm using my DVD recorder to basically convert the signal from coax to RCA and then sending it to the transmitter.  So basically I have the cable coming into the house going to the cable box which outputs via coax.  That coax goes into my DVD recorder then I use the RCA output to go into the transmitter.  A little extra work to setup, but it was well worth it.One of the things that I love is the IR repeater that is included.  With this repeater, I am able to change the channels from the room with the TV even with the cable box is in the other room.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product!
Reviews.Author: Randy D Otts
Reviews.Content: Fit the bill perfectly! All I needed was to transmit satellite channels from master bedroom to guest bedroom. Setup took only minutes and was simple. Picture and sound quality is very good on an older CRT type television. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: Wayneski
Reviews.Content: The RF link audio video transmitter is a good product it was easy to hook up, but initially the picture was and sound were bad. once you fine tune it look out you'll like it. I've got transmitter downstairs and receiver upstairs,next to the microwave and cordless phone and it's great.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: M. Fulkerson "Tech Junkie"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these to share our DirecTV signal between two TVs in different rooms where we infrequently would be using them at the same time.  I bought this product because it runs at 5.8 GHz and, from other product reviews, seemed to offer the best chance at a clear signal.  We have cordless phones and wireless Internet so I was afaid of interference.The system only took a couple of minutes to set up.  The picture quality is very good with no static.  The sound quality is also quite good and I could only detect the slightest of static on channels when there was no sound.  Our rooms are not in direct line of site and the product worked with doors shut in both rooms. We have no issue with interference with our 2.4 GHZ wireless Internet (older Linksys) and our 1.x Ghz wireless phones (panasonic)We liked it so much I'm going to buy another one!

Reviews.Title: Remote viewing
Reviews.Author: Peter "Finding My Way"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this to allow viewing a 2nd TV without the need for another cable connection.The video and stereo sound is transmitted from the source to the receiver in a different room, extending TV viewing to another set about 15ft away but through two walls.Sound and picture quality are good. I had no need to change channels but found the two of four available channels tested worked fine with no noticeable difference in quality (I did not test the other two) Unit retains the selected channel when re-powered.No issues with wireless network or any other interference as it is on the 5.8Ghz band. Worked straight out of the box, by simply connecting the supplied video and stereo RCA cable from the output of my cable box to the input of the transmitter, and then in the remote room connecting the receiver's outputs to the 2nd TV's video and sound inputs.  Aligned the paddle aerials toward each other, and switched on - actually I found the alignment is not too critical at this distance which was a surprise considering some of the other reviews.The aerials look like they may be subject to potential breakage as the mount allows them to rotate up and down as well as about 330degress of rotation. I have tucked the sets behind the TV in both rooms to protect them.Noticeable static when a person walks between the transmitter and reciever, but considering it is already transmitting through two walls I think this is acceptable performance.The one issue I have had is a can't get the IR extender to work at all.  This feature should allow you to control your source from the receiving room, (ie change the channel on the cable box while in the receiving room) by capturing the remote's InfraRed and retransmitting at the other end from an included 'mouse'.  This failing takes away some of the ease of use.  Otherwise the unit works as expected and so far has been a easy way to duplicate the signal to one TV to another is a different room.Will update if I find a solution.

Reviews.Title: Awesome technology.  Great for what it is.
Reviews.Author: Goody
Reviews.Content: I was not excited to pay an additional $15 a month to have a cable box in our bedroom to watch TV.  I was looking at Roku, WDtv, etc but really just wanted the live TV+DVR I was already paying for in my bedroom. After looking for a solution a few months I stumbled upon this gadget.I was skeptical as to how well it would work but now I'm a believer.  It was super easy to hook up and worked immediately.  You do not need to be technically inclined to get it going.  The signal and sound are great.  Granted, we're in a small condo and the signal doesn't have to travel that far but I'm still impressed with the quality.  It's not HD but I'll give that up to have no wires running through the house.Another HUGE bonus is that if I want to play Xbox and my wife doesn't feel like watching me cuss and ignore her she can watch TV+DVR in the bedroom since the Xbox and DVR are hooked up to the same TV.The system works with your DVR's remote from wherever you set up the receiver.  We have a Logitech remote so it makes it even easier.  I set up a 'Bedroom' option on the Logitech and one button turns on all the proper devices for bedroom television viewing.Go'on 'en getcha one'a these.

Reviews.Title: Great remote transmitter & reciever
Reviews.Author: Fitzgerald Enterprises "Tomfitzsr"
Reviews.Content: I replaced an old satellite tv "rabbit" device that gave up the ghost. This one runs over 5.4 hz and installs quickly and easily. Great range.

Reviews.Title: RF-Link AVS-5811 5.8GHz Audio and Video Transmission System with IR Repeater
Reviews.Author: G. Ewing
Reviews.Content: I just bought and installed this device. The instruction manual leaves a lot to be desired, but set up is not really that hard.  I tried to send the picture to an older TV I have that is located in my basement and about 30 feet away from the transmitter. The signal had to go through a wall and a floor.  The sound popped a lot and the picture quality was somewhat snowy. So I moved the older TV in the basement to an area just below my TV upstairs where the transmitter is hooked up, and the popping of the sound stopped and now the sound comes in clear. I can also easily change the channels on my Direct TV receiver using the IR receiver feature, so this works nice.  However, even though the signal is now traveling through just one floor and to a TV set no more than 15 feet away from the transmitter, the picture quality is still somewhat snowy.So I am not too impressed with this device. I had to move the TV with the receiver rather close to the TV with the transmitter to get the sound quality to be acceptable, but the picture quality is still poor.  The older TV I am using is one with a tube, and is not a LED or LCD flat screen TV so maybe this makes a difference.  Maybe this device work better with newer flat screen TVs. I just know the picture quality is not that good on an older TV using a tube even when that TV is placed just 15 feet and one floor away. So I give this product a 2 star rating.

Reviews.Title: Good product, does what it says
Reviews.Author: T Almeida
Reviews.Content: Not all products do what they say, but this one did.I had a similar product, but it operated on the 2.4GHz range, so cause me a lot of problems with my home wi-fi network, and vice-versa.This helped me eliminate those problems and I now get a great picture on the TV.

Reviews.Title: RF-Link well worth the money.
Reviews.Author: slipdisc
Reviews.Content: The RF-Link worked right out of the box with no adjustments necessary. It continues to function as advertised with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Meets my need
Reviews.Author: Philly Lady
Reviews.Content: This product was relatively easy to setup.  Initially we set this up with the tv in the basement to the tv in the kitchen and was able to change the channel by pointing the remote to the receiver.  However the transmitter was moved to the bedroom tv which is watched less often to avoid interrupting anyone from watching their preferred programming on the tv in the basement while I'm watching tv in the kitchen.  I plan to check if this is easily fixed by changing the channels on the transmitter and receiver and if so, I will update my review.But in the mean time, we are pleased with this purchase and saving money from purchasing an additional box from Directv.

Reviews.Title: Wow!  I didn't think it would work this well!!!
Reviews.Author: M. R. Lilly
Reviews.Content: I was searching for a way i could possibly send cable to the tv in our upstairs bedroom without running cable across the floor (it currently comes into the room in an inconvenient place).  I began searching for a wireless method, half expecting this to still be science fiction.But, voila, here on amazon i see just such a device, and after reading several reviews, it seemed to actually work.i bought it with some reservation, assuming it would NOT work.however, i am extremely pleased to say that it works!  and works pretty good!we currently have the transmitter hooked to our tivo premiere downstairs with the supplied composite cable, and the receiver hooked to our tv in the upstairs bedroom.even though we have hd channels, as is mentioned in other reviews, the signal transmitted is not in hd.  however, it is a pretty good, strong signal, and it suits our in-bed tv watching expectations, which are pretty low.i purchased an additional tivo remote from amazon, which i leave upstairs, and it controls the tivo downstairs!there are some imperfections inherent in this device which you have to expect, though.  walking around, blocking the signal causes the picture to break up.  once we settle down this stops completely.another one is, to work the remote from upstairs, you have to affix some boondoggle to cover the remote receiver on your cable box/dvd player/tivo, whatever you are transmitting from.  this needs to be covering the little spot almost completely, which means for US, that we have to move it off and on depending if we want watch tv downstairs or upstairs.  just a minor irritation, but definitely a factor in its use for us...overall, i'm amazed that this thing works, and i think it's pretty cool.  if you can put up with babying it for the sake of wirelessly watching your media, this thing is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Works great, even in the ceiling.
Reviews.Author: K. McDaniel "Gadget King"
Reviews.Content: We have a set up where we are using this to have a TV in the master bathroom.  The problem has never been the distance, it is only about 30 feet from the TV in the master bedroom , but the problem is that we have the receiver in the ceiling in a crawl space.  It is next to a ceiling mounted HVAC unit, so, lots of metal and power and interruption.This unit is our third one that we tried in this environment - and it works perfectly.  Perfect picture and sound!

Reviews.Title: RF-Link AVS-5811 5.8GHz Audio and Video Transmission System with IR Repeater
Reviews.Author: pomeranians
Reviews.Content: I could not be happier with this product.  I am projecting about 40' through 4 sheet rock walls and down to another level of the house.  The picture and sound are amazing, much better than I expected.  Set-up took all of about 5 minutes.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Happy customer
Reviews.Author: J. Liu "snow tiger"
Reviews.Content: I have had this device about 1 and half years now, works great, never had any problem, I like it so much, I am buying another one.

Reviews.Title: TV out side using RF-Link
Reviews.Author: Noodle
Reviews.Content: The RF-Link for out side TV viewing was what I wanted.  This solution provided exactly what I needed.  It linked very well via wireless feed from my Satellite feed out to the porch.  The picture was great with little interference. I would recommend if looking for an answer for 30-40 yards.

Reviews.Title: Didn't solve the problem
Reviews.Author: M. Hinkle
Reviews.Content: This seemed like a great solution in theory when neither the cable co. nor my electrician could find an easy way to run cable to the 3rd floor of my house.  Though the distance didn't seem further than recommended, the units were not communicating well. When we finally did get it working, it was inconveniently place and a bit temperamental. We ended up returning the system.

Reviews.Title: Terrific product. Works like a charm.
Reviews.Author: . "Chip..."
Reviews.Content: My transmitter is on the first floor in the kitchen. The receiver is on the second floor in the far bedroom. I get great video/audio and the remote control works flawlessly. The IR blaster sends the signal needed to control the dish box. It's like having a Dish receiver in the bedroom.I read other comments on the instructions being sketchy. The instructions are as complete as needed. This Thing is "Plug-and-Play". Set the send/receive channel desired, plug in the IR blaster on the sender and away you go.I highly recommend the RF-Link if you need to connect wireless to a remote TV.

Reviews.Title: Not meant for connecting PC monitors to TVs
Reviews.Author: B. Aronson
Reviews.Content: I bought this product so that I could connect my computer monitor to my 46" HD TV in order to watch youtube, netflix, and downloaded videos on my TV.  However, after receiving the item, I found out that I need another $70 PC to TV converter in order to accomplish this.  While this was doable, the product is rather large and unwieldly compared to similarly priced products.  I am returning this item and buying a Western Digital TV Live Plus instead, which is smaller, runs for a similar price, and does everything I wanted this product to do.

Reviews.Title: Very good product
Reviews.Author: Craig C
Reviews.Content: This unit performed very well and we are very happy with it. It would be nice if they made a battery pack for it so it could be used for field video production.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Raunch3131
Reviews.Content: I love it.  Minutes to set up. Looks better than I imagined it would. It's not high def, but more resolution than needed for a kitchen TV. Remote channel changing works great.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup and does the job
Reviews.Author: Adelaide
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to send my cable DVR signal from the first floor to a second floor room without a cable jack.  I had the device up and running in about five minutes after the box arrived.  As others have mentioned, you can basically ignore the instructions about positioning and just plug the thing in.  I am able to access all of the features of the connected DVR (recorded programs, etc).  The transmitter is positioned within three feet of a 5.8 GHz phone and thus far I have had no significant interference problems.  The occasional interference that I have experienced has been brief and minor, and possibly in relation to something happening outside of my house.  I've only had this for 24 hours, but thus far I am completely pleased.  This device does the job with minimal effort.

Reviews.Title: RF-Link AVS 5811 Information
Reviews.Author: Ward S
Reviews.Content: I received the first order it worked transmitting audio and video.  I could not figure out the IR remote.  I called the factory and left a message which was never responded to.  Then it suddenly stopped.  One power supply went dead.  I returned the order for an exchange and was impressed with Amazon's excellent service.  The second order works fine (audio, video) except I can not figure out the IR remote and there is no information in the instructions on how it is suppose to be set up or how it works other then lay the remote transmitter next to the source IR receiver.  Really leaves much to be desired when it comes to any help or instruction.  I have not been able to find any help on the web like most companies offer. I have still not figured it out and don't know where to turn so I will probably just do without the remote control.  It's OK if you don't expect any help and it may not function as planned.  A friend has the exact system and his works fine.  He attempted to assist but no gain.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: JoeShmoe
Reviews.Content: I just got this the other day and it has so far been working great! I wanted to be able to listen to TV while in the kitchen as well as in the living room. What's nice is that I don't have to pay for another cable box which would cost me $15+ per month on top of having to pay for someone to run a wire under my floor. One problem you may have is trying to find more A/V outputs for video and sound on your cable box. Overall I love the product and hope to have continuous connection.

Reviews.Title: AV Sender/Receiver
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Padgette
Reviews.Content: I have had this equipment for about 2 months now and use it almost daily.  For me, it works perfect and I have no complaints.  It was easy to hook up and the instructions are straight forward.  The audio/video are very good.  I was surprised at how good the audio/video quality was.  I watch a lot of Hulu old movies and SyFy episodes.  Using the RF-Link, in conjunction with the AV Sender, makes it possible to stream straight from the Internet to your TV in another room.  Hope this helps you out.One other thing, if your graphics card supports two monitors that makes it much easier to setup and control your remote TV.  The RF-Link makes this possible.

Reviews.Title: Works great in my situation
Reviews.Author: C. Wilen
Reviews.Content: My setup is to use a 2nd TV in a patio room about 30" from the sender. The indoor patio door is double pane glass. I've had the 900MHz and that worked for a while until there was too much local interference. Then I got the 2.4GHz set up that that was fine until recently when someone nearby (or maybe me) started running something that caused significant interference. With both the 900 and 2.4, I had to leave the door open to get a good signal.I got the 5.8GHz and had it running in about 1 minute. Granted, all I did was change out the 2.4Ghz model so there was not searching around to figure out which cable goes where.  There is no interference and picture is pretty darned good. Also, I can keep the glass door closed with no signal loss.  I haven't tried the IR repeater so I can't comment on whether that works well or not.

Reviews.Title: sweet
Reviews.Author: Shirley Gaisser
Reviews.Content: i have spent hundreds of dollars on cables to have tv in different rooms. the almost always have noise on them, no matter what type i use.  This product works perfectly with a clear picture and sound. Best solution I have seen.

Reviews.Title: Surprising find for remote TV share cable is not an option
Reviews.Author: Mike Monk
Reviews.Content: I needed a TV in a room with no cable and my home does not permit modification of cabling to this location.  I was skeptical but having read reviews of various products, this seemed to offer the least likelihood of problem because of the frequency used.  The process is almost too easy and the rather poor directions make it seem like it should be more difficult.  If you skip the reading and just connect each end, one to the TV and the other to a cable box or other video out, you're done.  The instructions seem to suggest that the highly directional antennas must be carefully aligned.  No so.  We have one in a cabinet and there is no alignment, line or sight or any unobstructed path.  With some buzzing on occasion, we simply moved the device a few inches and ended that problem.  This is a winner.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Product
Reviews.Author: Ravindra Nanga "rnanga"
Reviews.Content: Very easy to set up. Does what it says. Worked right out of the box, the IR feature worked great from the receiver.

Reviews.Title: Great over short distances
Reviews.Author: dhm19382 "dhm"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this to replace an older 900 MHz transmitter / receiver that had poor picture quality and suffered interference with microwave oven.  This unit's picture and sound quality is quite good, and is free from interference.  Our application range is about 25 feet, separated by a stone wall, but I suspect signal path is through a doorway between the units.  We do have occasional signal interference when we walk directly in front of the receiving unit, although this is not significant problem.

Reviews.Title: TV repeater
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: This item worked exactly as I wanted, my old one died after 6 years. We use it in the kitchen,this one even allows us to operate the microwave without interference with the video or audio.

Reviews.Title: WORKS GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Gianluca Viale
Reviews.Content: Hooked up in a flash, works perfectly through the floor.If only it had a standby feature...

Reviews.Title: Works as well as I hoped
Reviews.Author: M. Nagy
Reviews.Content: This product works great in the situation we have it in... The signal is easily disturbed by people walking through it, but it is generally stable.

Reviews.Title: Solved my issue and works well.
Reviews.Author: D. Sanders
Reviews.Content: I bought this to transmit only audio upstairs to another receiver. My outdoor speakers are connected there, and now I can have the same music upstairs, downstairs, and outside all at once.I have not tried any video transmission, so I don't know the quality.The audio quality is nearly perfect. My desired range is rather short (maybe 25 feet, downstairs to upstairs), but the signal never drops. I do get an occasional "pop" now and then, but I can live with it. 99% of the time sound quality is awesome.

Reviews.Title: fine, but don't use in close proximity to airport hub
Reviews.Author: gregalo
Reviews.Content: Like the title says, I had a good experience with this transmitter (was very impressed actually) until I bought an apple airport wireless router. Now when the airport is on, I see a thin white bar of static cycling through the video display, suggesting interference. When I'm connected to the modem via ethernet (and the airport is off) this problem goes away, so it's definitely the airport. Blocking the airport with some LP cases reduces the static but not entirely. The audio has been stellar otherwise, except for some odd sounds when I come between the transmitter and the receiver. So all in all, I am impressed with the clarity of the picture, though annoyed that I can't have the device in the same room as my wireless router.

Reviews.Title: Great If You Need To Penetrate Walls
Reviews.Author: Amazon Addict
Reviews.Content: I tried a cheaper version of this device, and it did not work. I cheaped out and did not buy this one in the beginning, but I wish I had. With this device, I'm able to transmit the TV signal from our family room to our kitchen without problem. The signal goes through 2 walls (including a travertine backsplash on one of the walls) without a problem. The picture quality is not the same as a wired connection, but I expected that. The quality is very good and you can hardly see a difference. Overall I'm very pleased. The cheaper models just don't work - get this one.

Reviews.Title: Who Could Ask for More!
Reviews.Author: SRK "Happy in Cal"
Reviews.Content: I've been trying to figure out how to get video into our bathroom for 2 years.  there was no good way to run a new cable without major construction.  A relative told me about wireless so I investigated and found this unit.  I have a wireless computer network plus wireless phones so I wanted to make sure things wouldn't interfere.  This setup  seemed to meet the need. (higher freq than the computer and lower than my phones)  It took all of ten minutes to hook everything up and bang, I had TV in the bathroom.  The remote works and everything.  Exactly as advertised.  The picture is great and the sound is just fine.  I always read the negative reviews before I order on line and I can't believe anyone has a problem with this gear.  All I can figure is they didn't do the homework to assure they won't have a problem with some other device in their home.

Reviews.Title: Works great for our patio!
Reviews.Author: G. Daniel
Reviews.Content: At first I had a bit of a problem getting a good picture but then I switched the base to a different tv and it works great. Easy way for us to watch tv on our patio!

Reviews.Title: Limited Use, but good so far
Reviews.Author: V. Patel
Reviews.Content: Setup was very easy.  I have a cable box in an upstairs rec. room that I hooked the transmitter to.  A small tv in the kitchen downstairs that I hooked the receiver to.  I can't tell any loss in video/audio signal quality.  Seems to work pretty good.  Only issue I had was that the remote through the IR repeater that came with it, didn't work all that well initially.  I moved the receiver away from the walls a little bit and that seems to solve this issue.  But the item doesn't seem to have a problem relaying the signal from one floor and one side of the house to the other floor and other side of the house.  So far, I'm satisfied, works like I wanted.  I'll update the review if anything changes.

Reviews.Title: Works As Advertised
Reviews.Author: Annabelle Lee
Reviews.Content: Works exactly as advertised.  We had a standard wifi unit before and it was very much affected by interference from spread-spectrum phones, microwaves, etc.  No problems at all with this one.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Product; Poor Instructions; How to Connect to Cable Box
Reviews.Author: Glen R. Cipriani "painless"
Reviews.Content: We have a small LCD TV in our bathroom and wanted to watch cable channels from our living room cable box. This product enabled us to receive AND CHANGE any channel from our bathroom remotely. It went through 3 walls (about 20 feet) and works beautifully. I got a "pop" in the sound at first, but aligned the "dish" a little and it was eliminated. The included instructions are poor. I hooked up the transmitter to the Directv cable box with the included RCA cables to the back of the Directv HD cable box (Optical Out, color-coded) and placed the IR extension just below the front IR sensor with the supplied tape. Then, I hooked up the RF-Link receiver to our bathroom TV using the RCA inputs. Make sure both RF-Links are OFF before hooking up. Then I switched on our bath TV, changed to the "video" input (instead of TV or Cable) using the TV remote, switched on the RF-Links, and using the CABLE TV remote (from Directv) pointed at the BATH RF-Link receiver and switch the power on, remotely, for the cable box. Just make sure the little "dish" on the RF-Links face each other (concave surfaces pointed toward each other). Then fine tune the position for best reception.

Reviews.Title: Don't be optimistic, the image will be noisy.
Reviews.Author: A. Pickett
Reviews.Content: I wanted to believe that some of the reviews I read about the RF-Link introducing static wouldn't be true for me.  For my test setup I placed the transmitter and receiver less than 3' apart and immediately saw (or failed to see) dropped frames.  This system would likely work fine for transmitting the signal from a security camera, but not for entertainment equipment.Thankfully, Amazon has a good return policy.

Reviews.Title: Wireless video transmitter for cable tv
Reviews.Author: S. Ahuja "medioindio"
Reviews.Content: I must admit I was a bit sceptical when I ordered the product but I thought I could always return  it considering amazon's excellent return policy. Well, it does the job excellently. No need for rewiring the apartment, waiting endless hours for the cable guy etc etc. Its pretty much plug and play and you can even remotely change channels using the remote that comes with your cable box. You don't have to be a techie type to set it up which was one of my concerns. Picture quality is perfect at around 100 feet through a couple of walls (dry wall)although I haven't tried it with HD. All in all a good product.

Reviews.Title: Good for an extra small TV...
Reviews.Author: Smart Doc
Reviews.Content: I used this gadget to put a TV in the kitchen for my wife. There is no TV wiring in the kitchen. I Connected the transmitter to the DVR-Receiver from Dish Network and the receiver in the kitchen. The signal goes through one wall. Both places in discrete places.
