Reviews.Content: It is a pleasant surprise when you receive a product that does exactly what it claims to.That is the case with the RF Link AVS-5811 5.8 GHz Wireless Audio/Video Sender/Receiver. No more interference from my cordless phones, which had alwys been a problem. Also--the unit did not interfere with my in home WIFI computer network at all.  Great product!!  Thanks

Reviews.Title: Great technology, bad execution
Reviews.Author: Glenn Garde
Reviews.Content: Like others, I found this system easy to set up with immediately clear picture reception.  The transimitter is upstairs about 40 feet and two interfering walls away from the receiver, yet the reception is great without having to spend much time on antenna adjustment.I sent my first unit back to Amazon thinking it was broken because I could not get the IR transmitter to work with any of my VCRs or DVD players.  The replacement had the same problem.  What I have come to realize is that it is not a defective RF Link product, rather this IR functionality just does not work with Panasonic equipment.  It works perfectly with my JVC TV and my Sony TV.Of course the lame instructions supplied with the RF Link unit do not say anything about brand compatibility.  I had to figure this out for myself, which wasted a lot of time and caused great frustration.I am going to keep this unit and get a seperate remote control extender since this is really the only decent solution for the way my house is set up.  However, I can't wait for some reputable company to introduce a 5.8ghz system that does everything it's supposed to and has good instructions and support.

Reviews.Title: cable tv wall coaxial jack
Reviews.Author: james linn
Reviews.Content: i bought this to avoid making holes on my walls to transmit cable tv to different TV sets. but to my disappointment when i received my AVS-5811 the transmitter has no coaxial input jack. it only comes with A/V RCA jacks. How do you connect this transmitter to cable TV coaxial wall jacks? help Anybody!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: mlchael c walker
Reviews.Content: Does not work as advertised.  Walking thru room interferes withsignal. Tried to change location but saw no improvement inresults.

Reviews.Title: A real waste................
Reviews.Author: Mary Amelia
Reviews.Content: Why did the description or any of the reviews indicate it is not able to work with a digital television and digital output. Perhaps I should have known this, but I read the information and was led to believe I could make it work.  Nada...I am not a happy camper and my Masters degree is in communication, so I am returning this lame thing and hoping others read and heed

Reviews.Title: Works, but...
Reviews.Author: Daytona Bird "Infrequent Buyer"
Reviews.Content: This does the job of getting signal from cable box to remote TV (through one wall), but I haven't figured out how to avoid one quirk. Cable box connected to HD TV via HDMI cable, but,while it worked OK at first, I now find that I have to disconnect te HDMI from the cable box or I get no signal to remote TV. I'll keep playing with this, but if anyone knows of a solution, i.e., to avoid disconnecting the HDMI cable, please post.

Reviews.Title: be careful
Reviews.Author: Dan Willert
Reviews.Content: Seemed like an easy solution to my problem, but this product does not penetrate walls with it's signal, as advertised. Instructions were a bit lacking. Found the manufacturer's web site, signed in, asked for help.........absolutely NO RESPONSE.

Reviews.Title: Just fine
Reviews.Author: Rene DiMarco
Reviews.Content: This system works fine as a TV signal extender, but for good quality of the video a line of sight between the tx and the Rx is a MUST. Even for short distances, the signal goes "snowy" once a wall is between the transmitter and the receiver.If distance and Line of Sight are not a problem for you, it's recommended.I use it for sending my Directv decoder signal to a new small TV in the kitchen and it worked. Sometimes I just send audio to a couple of speakers and they are OK. The remote control extender is a great idea.Again, for short distances it works. I can't see it working at 300 feet as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work!
Reviews.Author: khanman
Reviews.Content: TV is in the living room, second TV i bedroom, one room inbetween the two and it doesn't work at all.

Reviews.Title: Did not work for me.
Reviews.Author: Mememememememe "pHLe"
Reviews.Content: Using the unit across two rooms but could not get a clear signal on any of the 4 channels. Multiple big white bars scrolling from bottom to top of screen and many popping and crackling noise.

Reviews.Title: Other uses
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: I think the product stinks for as a video sending unit but for extended RF singals it is awesome. I have a TV mounted on a wall and all of the AV equipment behind the wall in a closet. I use this to forward the cable RF signal from the TV room to the closet and it works great compared to the other garbage RF sending units out there.

Reviews.Title: Loved it, until ....
Reviews.Author: D. Gipson
Reviews.Content: Purchased the RF-Link to connect an inside Dish DVR to (my dream) of a TV in the back yard. Connection was simple and testing this with an inside TV receiver resulted in a good picture/sound. However, as soon as I took the receiver out the door and connected it to a TV a few feet from the house, I got horizontal lines flipping around on the screen. I turned off any equipment that possibly could cause interference and no luck. Reluctantly I returned this and will continue my search. So, for in the house ... even through many walls and and two stories it worked great. But at least outside at my house, no luck :(

Reviews.Title: Delivers 75% of what it promises.....
Reviews.Author: Randall
Reviews.Content: Great if you need to extend a Sat, DVR, DVD, etc.. Allows you to use your remote to change channels, etc.. Does not delivery full distance unless you live in the theoretical world, 1 million miles from any RF interference, clear radio line of site on Mars, etc.. Like most of these devices the claims need to be cut it in half and hope that works (Like the old days of EPA gas mileage) Was able to get a decent signal that would fade some going thru three interior sheetrock walls from the den to a remote bedroom. Great if you need a low end extension and don't want to sink hundreds into a high end piece of gear.Not sure where the confusion lies on the remote its really easy to setup. You plug the incuded remote eye into the transmitter unit and put that eye in front of the device you want to control. Then take that remote into the room with the far end receiver unit you just purchased and point the remote at it and it works.I would purchase another unit, they are decent and make for great remote viewing of a TV signal at lets say your Hot Tub ;-)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Gretchen Caldwell
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews and they seemed positive.  We've had a Radio Shack transmitter for about 5 or 6 years, and it was awful.  Prone to interferance, was useless when the microwave oven was on, etc.  This system is absolutely fantastic!  We use it to transmit from the family room to the kitchen.  The TV in the kitchen is literally under the microwave oven, and next to the cordless phone.  Not ONE bit of interferance.  No lines, no hums, no noises, nothing.  It's a crystal clear picture, sound is great too.  Haven't yet taken the time to set up the IR mouse, but as others said, directions on this are scanty.  Will go back through the reviews to figure htis out further.As to aligning the two units (sender / receiver), they aer roughly pointed in the same direction, and that's it.  No fiddling at all, just plug and play from the video feed box.Highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Like the product, but customer service not so good so am giving a 2.
Reviews.Author: A. Sutherland
Reviews.Content: I bought the product and it was working great for 1.5 months and still works with the exception of the fact that I can't use my remote from my bedroom now.  I have to go into the other room and change the TV.  I called the company and I have to send the transmitter, receiver and the IR Mouse back (AT MY COST).  They said they could have it up to 2 weeks.  They will try to repair it and if not, they will replace.  This is all good but I am a bit miffed by the fact that I have to incur the cost of shipping when it is clearly their defect.  And, that I have to go without TV in my bedroom (sad I know) because of their defect.  I wish they were more accomodating but alas they aren't and I am at their mercy.Will update after the unit is fixed.So, I did send it back at my cost and they fixed and it is still working so I am happy with that.

Reviews.Title: This device breaks after two years of careful use.  RF-Link does not honor warranty.
Reviews.Author: Gregory M. Fitch "Automated Vehicles Systems,...
Reviews.Content: My RF-Link broke after two years of limited use.  The company was not interested in repairing the device or replacing it.  Don't buy this product.  There are numerous reviews like mine that state that the device fails after limited use.  Buyer beware... too bad I didn't get warned when I bought it.

Reviews.Title: great picture, doesn't work with sci atlanta 8300HD cable box remote
Reviews.Author: M. Leisner
Reviews.Content: I had a Terk Leapfrog which seemed to be at the end of its life (the remote was flakey, and I always hat interference with 801.11g with its 2.4G frequency.This looked interesting -- and it used 5.8G.I ordered it with one day shipping from amazon -- the picture/video was outstanding, but the remote didn't work.  So I contacted Amazon, and they shipped me another (with 1 day shipping).The new one worked like the old one -- so I decided to try some other components with remotes (an Onkyo receiver, a Samsung TV) -- no problem.I contacted the vendor -- and had a nice phone call with them.  But they were puzzled why some Scientific Atlanta boxes worked, and others didn't.  They asked cisco for information, but cisco wasn't forthcoming.  I sympathize with them, but I spent several hours playing with the device.  Cruising the internet, I came across other people who had the same problem.What is maddening is Terk doesn't have a problem.  Amazon refunded part of my purchase price (thanks Amazon -- you were stellar) and I bought a Terk remote control extender which has no problem.The video/audio is great, when I walk close to it with a 5.8G phone, it breaks up a little.  My801.11g connections don't cause interference (but I have to see how 801.11n works).Very mixed feelings -- but I'm happy I have everything working now.

Reviews.Title: Ok for the time
Reviews.Author: L. Honda
Reviews.Content: I got this a while ago.It was ok for the time.The reception was a bit snowy in another room.Theres probably something better by now.

Reviews.Title: Crappy Remote
Reviews.Author: Pat Munday "EcoRover"
Reviews.Content: Generally a good product EXCEPT for the cheesy remote. Started eating batteries then quit altogether. So far no luck on getting the RF-Link to work with a universal remote.

Reviews.Title: Started off great, however performance degrades over time
Reviews.Author: Anon
Reviews.Content: This product worked great for me right off the bat.  I tried one of the 2.4 GHz systems but like everyone else, I had way too much interference.  The 5.8 GHz system seemed like the perfect answer since I didn't have anything in that spectrum.  The picture quality was pretty good and the only thing I noticed was a horizontal ghosting on images with high contrast.  It wasn't too bad so I decided to live with it.It is now exactly one month since I bought this item and, although I have not moved the transmitter & receiver, I am having new picture quality issues such as black/white picture only for a few seconds.  This could be due to my neighbors getting a new phone but this effect is shown on all 4 "channels".I gave three stars due to the degredation of performance and the price tag.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Conwell Ottenritter
Reviews.Content: Works great and a real money saver with greedy DirecTV who wants to charge $5 more a month for each additional TV we have.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: BP
Reviews.Content: Does exactly what it is supposed to do.  I did have to change the batteries in my remote because it isn't as sensitive as the receiver on the DVR.

Reviews.Title: RF Link AVS-5811 5.8 GHz Wireless
Reviews.Author: Mani Mohtasham
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: Check this first buyer beware
Reviews.Author: E. Stack
Reviews.Content: So if you have any kind of scientific atlanta cable box the ir blaster will not work. I called tech support and of course they know all about the issue but you never find out until you buy it and the guy actually said I should buy a seperate ir sender...unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: Not quite what I expected
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Product works fine if connecting to products that are close together, but if far apart with any type of electronic equipment in between the unit picks up static making the video unwatchable.

Reviews.Title: Missing connector
Reviews.Author: David A. Olson
Reviews.Content: I thought the product had a Coax. I wanted to use on the TV in question. Otherwise the product works fine.

Reviews.Title: Not the one I thought it was
Reviews.Author: moerschen
Reviews.Content: I bought this because it said in the description that it was great for sending what you saw on your computer screen to your HDTV. When I read the instructions, I discovered that maybe it would do that, but with great difficulty in connecting it to my computer. I was looking for a simple wireless connection to my TV. Then as I went through the other literature that came with the unit, I saw they make 4 types of these wireless devices, and one is specifically made for computer to HDTV. So I sent this one back to Amazon for a refund (great company for getting a quick refund if you are not satisfied) and they refunded my money. Now I will start looking for the one they make that is specifically made to connect a Computer to a TV.

Reviews.Title: do not buy...
Reviews.Author: Sherman "Hill"
Reviews.Content: i tried it and gave up. The picture quality is very bad. cant go thought 3 walls... I used it for 1 time. don't waste your money

Reviews.Title: Hard to say...
Reviews.Author: terry gendreau "terry"
Reviews.Content: I can't write a fair review of this product. It was incompatible with my (admittedly outdated) system.  I had to send it back.  It might wirk just fine with a more sophisticated system but it didn't work at all for me.

Reviews.Title: Item description is inaccurate!
Reviews.Author: Michael Cooney
Reviews.Content: I ordered this transmission system and only received a sender unit. The ad clearly states it should be a transmitter and receiver! Don't purchase this item!

Reviews.Title: slow shipping
Reviews.Author: South Texan "TEX"
Reviews.Content: I cannot comment on the item itself yet, I ordered on the 14th. of Sept and the item was shipped on the 18th. accordeing to the tracking number it still has three more days in transit.The best part is it comes from less than 800 miles away.?I would forget about the "free shipping" if you want it anytime soon.I am about to give up on AMAZON, they are getting worse and worse, probably because they are getting too big to care about who made them what they are.

Reviews.Title: What is included?!
Reviews.Author: Randy Stulce "Randy"
Reviews.Content: The manufacturer web site says it includes both transmitter and receiver units. [...]  But does it?

Reviews.Title: Was the situation corrected?
Reviews.Author: D. Brodsky
Reviews.Content: I wanted to buy this item (since the 2.4MHZ item of the same kind did not work at my place due to all the interferences) but the previus review stopped me.  I wonder if the previous reviewer's situation was corrected by amazon.com in that they sent the right item.  I could not find the direct email of the previous reviewer to ask directly.
